verses.latin: Apocalypsis Iesu Christi, quam dedit illi Deus palam facere servis suis, quae oportet fieri cito: et significavit, mittens per angelum suum servo suo Ioanni,
verses.english: This is the revelation of Jesus Christ, which God the Father gave to God the Son, so that He could make known to His servants what must quickly happen. And God the Son made it known by sending His Angel to His servant John.

verses.latin: qui testimonium perhibuit verbo Dei, et testimonium Iesu Christi, quaecumque vidit.
verses.english: John bore witness to the Word of God—the Son, Jesus Christ—and to everything he saw.

verses.latin: Beatus qui legit, et audit verba prophetiae huius: et servat ea, quae in ea scripta sunt. Tempus enim prope est.
verses.english: Blessed is he who reads, and those who hear the words of this prophecy, and who keep the things written in it. For the time is near for these things to unfold.

verses.latin: Ioannes septem ecclesiis quae sunt in Asia, gratia vobis, et pax ab eo, qui est, et qui erat, et qui venturus est, et a septem spiritibus qui in conspectu throni eius sunt,
verses.english: John writes to the seven churches that are in Asia. May grace and peace be with you from Him who is, and who was, and who is to come—the Eternal Father, and from the seven Spirits who are before His throne.

verses.latin: et ab Iesu Christo, qui est fidelis testis, primogenitus mortuorum, et princeps regum terrae, qui dilexit nos, et lavit nos a peccatis nostris in sanguine suo,
verses.english: And may grace and peace be with you from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful Witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the Prince of the kings of the earth. He loved us and washed us from our sins in His own Blood.

verses.latin: et fecit nos regnum, et sacerdotes Deo et Patri suo: ipsi gloria et imperium in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: And He made us a kingdom of priests for God, His Father. To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.

verses.latin: Ecce venit cum nubibus, et videbit eum omnis oculus, et qui eum pupugerunt. Et plangent se super eum omnes tribus terrae. Ita, Amen.
verses.english: Behold, He comes with the clouds, and every eye will see Him—even those who pierced Him. All the tribes of the earth will mourn over Him. Yes, truly, Amen.

verses.latin: Ego sum Alpha et Omega, principium et finis, dicit Dominus Deus, qui est, et qui erat, et qui venturus est, omnipotens.
verses.english: "I am the Alpha and the Omega," says the Lord God, "the Beginning and the End—the One who is, and who was, and who is to come—the Almighty."

verses.latin: Ego Ioannes frater vester, et particeps in tribulatione, et in regno, et patientia Iesu Christi, fui in insula, quae appellatur Patmos, propter verbum Dei, et testimonium Iesu Christi.
verses.english: I, John, your brother and companion in the tribulation, and in the kingdom, and in the patient endurance of Jesus Christ, was on the island called Patmos because of the Word of God—the Son, and because of the testimony of Jesus Christ.

verses.latin: Fui in spiritu in dominica die, et audivi post me vocem magnam tamquam tubae,
verses.english: I was in the Spirit on the Lord's Day, and I heard behind me a loud voice, like the sound of a trumpet.

verses.latin: dicentis: Quod vides, scribe in libro: et mitte septem ecclesiis, quae sunt in Asia, Epheso, et Smyrnae, et Pergamo, et Thyatirae, et Sardis, et Philadelphiae, et Laodiciae.
verses.english: The voice said: "Write what you see in a book, and send it to the seven churches that are in Asia: to Ephesus, and to Smyrna, and to Pergamum, and to Thyatira, and to Sardis, and to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea."

verses.latin: Et conversus sum ut viderem vocem, quae loquebatur mecum: et conversus vidi septem candelabra aurea:
verses.english: I turned to see the voice that was speaking with me. And having turned, I saw seven golden lampstands.

verses.latin: et in medio septem aureorum candelabrorum, similem Filio hominis, vestitum podere, et praecinctum ad mamillas zona aurea:
verses.english: And in the midst of the seven golden lampstands, I saw one like the Son of Man, clothed with a garment reaching to His feet, and girded at the chest with a golden sash.

verses.latin: caput autem eius, et capilli erant candidi tamquam lana alba, et tamquam nix, et oculi eius velut flamma ignis:
verses.english: His head and His hair were white, like white wool or like snow, and His eyes were like a flame of fire.

verses.latin: et pedes eius similes orichalco, sicut in camino ardenti, et vox illius tamquam vox aquarum multarum:
verses.english: His feet were like fine brass, as if refined in a furnace, and His voice was like the sound of many waters—a mighty roar.

verses.latin: et habebat in dextera sua stellas septem: et de ore eius gladius utraque parte acutus exibat: et facies eius sicut sol lucet in virtute sua.
verses.english: He held seven stars in His right hand. From His mouth came a sharp, two-edged sword, and His face shone like the sun in its full strength.

verses.latin: Et cum vidissem eum, cecidi ad pedes eius tamquam mortuus. Et posuit dexteram suam super me, dicens: Noli timere: ego sum primus, et novissimus,
verses.english: When I saw Him, I fell at His feet as though dead. But He laid His right hand upon me, saying: "Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last."

verses.latin: et vivus, et fui mortuus, et ecce sum vivens in saecula saeculorum: et habeo claves mortis et inferni.
verses.english: "I am the Living One. I was dead, and behold, I am alive forever and ever. I hold the keys of death and of hell."

verses.latin: Scribe ergo quae vidisti, et quae sunt, et quae oportet fieri post haec.
verses.english: "Therefore, write the things which you have seen, and the things which are, and the things which will take place after these."

verses.latin: Sacramentum septem stellarum, quas vidisti in dextera mea, et septem candelabrorum aureorum: septem stellae Angeli sunt septem ecclesiarum: et septem candelabra, septem Ecclesiae sunt.
verses.english: "The mystery of the seven stars which you saw in My right hand, and the seven golden lampstands is this: the seven stars are the Angels—the spiritual guardians—of the seven churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven Churches themselves."

verses.latin: Angelo Ephesi ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit qui tenet septem stellas in dextera sua, qui ambulat in medio septem candelabrorum aureorum:
verses.english: Write to the angel of the Church at Ephesus. Here are the words of the One who holds the seven stars in His right hand—the One who walks among the seven golden lampstands, which are the seven Churches.

verses.latin: Scio opera tua, et laborem, et patientiam tuam, et quia non potes sustinere malos: et tentasti eos qui se dicunt Apostolos esse, et non sunt: et invenisti eos mendaces:
verses.english: I know all that you do. I know your hard work and your patient endurance. And I know that you cannot tolerate evil people. You have tested those who falsely claim to be apostles but are not, and you have found them to be liars.

verses.latin: et patientiam habes, et sustinuisti propter nomen meum, et non defecisti.
verses.english: You have also persevered patiently, and you have endured hardship for My Name’s sake without growing weary or giving up.

verses.latin: Sed habeo adversus te pauca: quia caritatem tuam primam reliquisti.
verses.english: Yet, I have a few things against you: you have abandoned the fervent love you had for Me at first.

verses.latin: Memor esto itaque unde excideris: et age pœnitentiam, et prima opera fac: sin autem, venio tibi cito, et movebo candelabrum tuum de loco suo, nisi pœnitentiam egeris.
verses.english: Remember the spiritual heights from which you have fallen. Repent and return to doing the good works you did at the beginning of your faith. If you do not repent and change your ways, I will come to you swiftly and remove your lampstand from its place, meaning your Church itself could lose its existence or purpose.

verses.latin: Sed hoc habes, quia odisti facta Nicolaitarum, quæ et ego odi.
verses.english: But I do commend you for this: you utterly hate the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat ecclesiis. Vincenti dabo ei edere de ligno vitæ, quod est in paradiso Dei mei.
verses.english: Let anyone who has ears to hear understand what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches. To the one who overcomes and remains faithful, I will grant the right to eat from the Tree of Life, which is in the paradise of My God.

verses.latin: Et angelo Smyrnæ ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit Primus et Novissimus, qui fuit mortuus, et vivit:
verses.english: And to the angel of the Church at Smyrna, write these words: Here are the words of the First and the Last, who was dead and now lives.

verses.latin: Scio tribulationem tuam, et paupertatem tuam, sed dives es: et blasphemam dicentium se Judæos esse, et non sunt, sed sunt synagoga Satanæ.
verses.english: I know your suffering and persecution, and I know your material poverty. But you are spiritually rich. I also know the slander and blasphemies from those who claim to be Jews but are not truly God’s people. Instead, they are a synagogue of Satan.

verses.latin: Nihil horum timeas quæ passurus es. Ecce missurus est diabolus aliquos ex vobis in carcerem ut tentemini: et habebitis tribulationem diebus decem. Esto fidelis usque ad mortem: et dabo tibi coronam vitæ.
verses.english: Do not be afraid of any of the suffering you are about to face. Listen! The devil is about to throw some of you into prison so that you may be tested and tried. And you will suffer for a limited period of ten days. Remain faithful and steadfast, even to the point of death, and I will give you the crown of eternal life.

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat ecclesiis. Qui vicerit, non lædetur a morte secunda.
verses.english: Let anyone who has ears to hear understand what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches. The one who overcomes and remains faithful will not be harmed by the second death.

verses.latin: Et angelo Pergami ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit qui habet rhomphæam ex utraque parte acutam:
verses.english: And to the angel of the Church at Pergamum, write these words: Here are the words of the One who has the sharp, two-edged sword.

verses.latin: Scio ubi habitas, ubi sedes est Satanæ: et tenes nomen meum, et non negasti fidem meam. Et in diebus illis Antipas testis meus fidelis, qui occisus est apud vos ubi Satanas habitat.
verses.english: I know where you live, in the very city where Satan’s throne is located. Yet, you hold fast to My Name and have not denied your faith in Me. Even in those difficult days, when Antipas, My faithful witness, was martyred among you, right there where Satan dwells.

verses.latin: Sed habeo adversus te pauca: quia habes ibi tenentes doctrinam Balaam, qui docebat Balac mittere scandalum coram filiis Israël, edere et fornicari.
verses.english: Nevertheless, I have a few things against you: You tolerate some among you who cling to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to entice the Israelites into sin by eating food sacrificed to idols and by committing sexual immorality.

verses.latin: Ita et tu habes tenentes doctrinam Nicolaitarum similiter.
verses.english: Similarly, you also have those who cling to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

verses.latin: Similiter pœnitentiam age: si quo minus, venio tibi cito, et pugnabo cum illis in rhomphæa oris mei.
verses.english: Therefore, repent of these things and change your ways. Otherwise, I will come to you quickly and I will wage war against them with the sword of My mouth.

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat ecclesiis. Vincenti dabo ei manna absconditum, et dabo illi calculum candidum: et in calculo nomen novum scriptum, quod nemo scit, nisi qui accipit.
verses.english: Let anyone who has ears to hear understand what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches. To the one who overcomes and remains faithful, I will give some of the hidden manna to eat, symbolizing spiritual nourishment and eternal life. I will also give that person a white stone, a symbol of acquittal and honor, and on that stone, a new name will be written, which no one knows except the one who receives it, signifying a unique relationship with Me.

verses.latin: Et angelo Thyatiræ ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit Filius Dei, qui habet oculos ejus velut flammam ignis, et pedes ejus similes orichalco:
verses.english: And to the angel of the Church at Thyatira, write these words: Here are the words of the Son of God, who has eyes like a blazing fire and whose feet are like polished bronze, glowing as if refined in a furnace.

verses.latin: Scio opera tua, et fidem, et caritatem tuam, et ministerium, et patientiam tuam, et opera tua novissima plura prioribus.
verses.english: I know all that you do. I know your faith, your love, your service to others, and your patient endurance. Indeed, your more recent works are even greater than those you did at first.

verses.latin: Sed habeo adversus te pauca: quia permittis mulierem Jezabel, quæ se dicit propheten, docere et seducere servos meos, fornicari, et manducare de idolothytis.
verses.english: Yet, I have a few things against you: You tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess, and through her teaching, she misleads My servants into committing sexual immorality and eating food sacrificed to idols.

verses.latin: Et dedi illi tempus ut pœnitentiam ageret: et non vult pœnitentiam agere a fornicatione sua.
verses.english: I gave her time to repent and change her ways, but she refuses to repent of her immoral behavior.

verses.latin: Ecce mitto eam in lectum: et qui mœchantur cum ea, in tribulationem maximam, nisi pœnitentiam egerint ab operibus suis.
verses.english: Listen! I will cast her onto a bed of suffering and sickness. And those who commit adultery with her will be plunged into intense suffering and great tribulation, unless they repent of the evil works they learned from her.

verses.latin: Et filios ejus interficiam in morte: et scient omnes ecclesiæ, quia ego sum scrutans renas et corda: et dabo unicuique vestrum secundum opera vestra.
verses.english: I will also strike her followers with death. Then all the Churches will know that I am the One who searches the innermost thoughts and desires, as well as the intentions of the heart. And I will give to each one of you exactly what your works deserve.

verses.latin: Vobis autem dico, et ceteris qui Thyatiræ estis: quicumque non habent doctrinam hanc, et qui non cognoverunt altitudines Satanæ, quemadmodum dicunt, non mittam super vos aliud pondus:
verses.english: But to the rest of you in Thyatira, to all who do not hold to this false teaching, and who have not learned what some call the 'deep secrets' of Satan—I tell you: I will not lay any other burden upon you.

verses.latin: Tantum id quod habetis, tenete donec veniam.
verses.english: Only hold firmly to the truth you already have until I come again.

verses.latin: Et qui vicerit, et custodierit usque in finem opera mea, dabo illi potestatem super gentes,
verses.english: To the one who overcomes and remains faithful to My works until the very end, I will give that person authority over the nations.

verses.latin: et reget eos in virga ferrea, et tamquam vas figuli confringentur,
verses.english: That person will rule them with a rod of iron, and they will be shattered like earthenware vessels.

verses.latin: sicut et ego accepi a Patre meo: et dabo illi stellam matutinam.
verses.english: —just as I Myself have received this authority from My Father. And I will also give that person the Morning Star, which is Myself, symbolizing a share in My glory and rule.

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat ecclesiis.
verses.english: Let anyone who has ears to hear understand what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches.

verses.latin: Et angelo Ecclesiae Sardis scribe: Haec dicit, qui habet septem spiritus Dei, et septem stellas: Scio opera tua, quia nomen habes quod vivas, et mortuus es.
verses.english: And to the bishop of the Church in Sardis, write these words: 'These are the words of Him who possesses the seven Spirits of God—that is, the Holy Spirit in all His fullness—and the seven stars, who are the bishops of the Churches. I know all your deeds. You have the reputation among men of being spiritually alive, but in reality, you are spiritually dead.'

verses.latin: Esto vigilans, et confirma caetera, quae moritura erant: non enim invenio opera tua plena coram Deo meo.
verses.english: 'Wake up and be watchful! And strengthen the remaining good that is still alive within you, for it is on the verge of dying completely. For I have not found your deeds to be complete or perfect in the eyes of My God.'

verses.latin: In mente ergo habe, qualiter acceperis, et audieris: et serva, et pœnitentiam age. Si ergo non vigilaveris, veniam ad te tamquam fur, et nescies qua hora veniam ad te.
verses.english: 'Therefore, remember the pure teaching you received from the Apostles and how you first heard it. Hold fast to it, and repent of your spiritual slumber. If you do not wake up and remain watchful, I will come upon you suddenly, like a thief in the night, and you will not know the hour of My coming to judge you.'

verses.latin: Sed habes pauca nomina in Sardis, qui non inquinaverunt vestimenta sua: et ambulabunt mecum in albis, quia digni sunt.
verses.english: 'But there are a few people in Sardis who have not stained their garments with sin. These few will walk with Me in white robes, for they are worthy of this honor, having kept their purity.'

verses.latin: Qui vicerit, sic vestietur vestimentis albis, et non delebo nomen ejus de libro vitæ, et confitebor nomen ejus coram Patre meo, et coram Angelis ejus.
verses.english: 'The one who overcomes these spiritual trials will similarly be clothed in white garments, signifying their purity and victory. I will certainly not erase their name from the Book of Life, which records those who are destined for eternal salvation. And I will publicly acknowledge and declare their name before My Father and before His holy angels.'

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat Ecclesiis.
verses.english: 'He who has an ear, let him understand and pay close attention to what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches.'

verses.latin: Et angelo Philadelphiæ Ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit Sanctus et Verus, qui habet clavem David: qui aperit, et nemo claudit: claudit, et nemo aperit:
verses.english: And to the bishop of the Church in Philadelphia, write these words: 'These are the words of the Holy One, who is absolutely true, and who holds the key of David—the ultimate authority over the Kingdom of God, the Church. What He opens, no one can shut; and what He shuts, no one can open, for He has absolute power over all things.'

verses.latin: Scio opera tua: ecce dedi coram te ostium apertum, quod nemo potest claudere: quia modicam habes virtutem, et servasti verbum meum, et non negasti nomen meum.
verses.english: 'I know all your deeds. Behold, I have placed before you an open door for ministry and evangelism, and no one has the power to shut it. I have done this because you possess little worldly strength, yet you have kept My word faithfully and have never denied My name.'

verses.latin: Ecce dabo de synagoga Satanæ, qui dicunt se Judæos esse, et non sunt, sed mentiuntur: ecce faciam illos ut veniant, et adorent ante pedes tuos: et scient quia ego dilexi te.
verses.english: 'Behold, I will deliver into your hands those from the synagogue of Satan—those who falsely claim to be true Jews, God's chosen people, but are liars. Behold, I will make them come and prostrate themselves before your feet, showing their submission to you. This will happen so that they will know that I, Jesus Christ, have truly loved you.'

verses.latin: Quoniam servasti verbum patientiæ meæ, et ego te servabo ab hora tentationis, quæ ventura est super orbem terrarum universum tentare habitantes in terra.
verses.english: 'Because you have faithfully kept My command to endure with patience, I, in turn, will keep you safe during the coming hour of temptation—a time of severe trial which is about to come upon the entire world to test all who dwell on the earth.'

verses.latin: Ecce venio cito: tene quod habes, ut nemo accipiat coronam tuam.
verses.english: 'Behold, I am coming soon! Hold fast to the faith and good works you possess, so that no one may take away the crown of eternal life and glory that awaits you.'

verses.latin: Qui vicerit, faciam illum columnam in templo Dei mei, et foras non exibit amplius: et scribam super eum nomen Dei mei, et nomen civitatis Dei mei novæ Ierusalem, quæ descendit de cælo a Deo meo, et nomen meum novum.
verses.english: 'The one who overcomes will I make a steadfast pillar in the eternal temple of My God, and they shall never again have to leave it. I will inscribe upon them the very name of My God, and the name of the city of My God—the New Jerusalem, which descends from the sky, from My God Himself—and also My own new name. This signifies their permanent place, their divine ownership, and their intimate communion.'

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat Ecclesiis.
verses.english: 'He who has an ear, let him understand and pay close attention to what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches.'

verses.latin: Et angelo Laodicensium Ecclesiæ scribe: Hæc dicit: Amen, testis fidelis et verus, qui est principium creaturæ Dei.
verses.english: And to the bishop of the Church in Laodicea, write these words: 'These are the words of the Amen—that is, the Divine Truth Himself—the faithful and true witness to God's plan, who is the source and ruler of all God's creation, not a created being Himself.'

verses.latin: Scio opera tua, quia neque frigidus es, neque calidus: utinam frigidus esses, aut calidus.
verses.english: 'I know all your deeds, and you are neither spiritually cold nor spiritually hot. Oh, how I wish you were either truly cold, openly rejecting Me, or truly hot, fervently zealous for Me!'

verses.latin: Sed quia tepidus es, et nec frigidus, nec calidus, incipiam te evomere ex ore meo.
verses.english: 'But because you are lukewarm—neither truly cold nor truly hot—just like the nauseating, tepid water, I am about to spit you out of My mouth.'

verses.latin: Quia dicis: Quod dives sum, et locupletatus, et nullius egeo: et nescis quia tu es miser, et miserabilis, et pauper, et cæcus, et nudus.
verses.english: 'Because you boastfully declare, "I am rich and have acquired great wealth, and I am in need of nothing!"—yet you do not realize that in My sight, you are truly wretched, pitiable, spiritually poor, blind to truth, and naked of spiritual virtue.'

verses.latin: Suadeo tibi emere a me aurum ignitum probatum, ut locuples sis, et vestimentis albis induaris, ut non appareat confusio nuditatis tuæ, et collyrio inungere oculos tuos, ut videas.
verses.english: 'Therefore, I advise you to come and 'buy' from Me gold purified by fire, so that you may become truly rich in faith and good works. Also, 'buy' white garments from Me, so that you may clothe yourself and cover the shameful nakedness of your sins. And 'buy' eye salve from Me, to anoint your eyes so that you may regain your spiritual sight and truly understand.'

verses.latin: Ego quos amo, arguo, et castigo. Æmulare ergo, et pœnitentiam age.
verses.english: 'All those whom I truly love, I rebuke and discipline for their own good. Therefore, be zealous in your faith and promptly repent of your lukewarmness.'

verses.latin: Ecce sto ad ostium, et pulso. Si quis audierit vocem meam, et aperuerit mihi januam, intrabo ad illum, et cœnabo cum illo, et ipse mecum.
verses.english: 'Behold, I stand at the door of your heart and knock. If anyone hears My voice and opens the door to Me, I will come in to them, and I will share a meal with them in intimate communion, and they with Me.'

verses.latin: Qui vicerit, dabo ei sedere mecum in throno meo: sicut et ego vici, et sedi cum Patre meo in throno ejus.
verses.english: 'The one who overcomes will I grant the privilege to sit with Me on My throne, sharing in My royal authority—just as I Myself overcame the world and then sat down with My Father on His throne.'

verses.latin: Qui habet aurem, audiat quid Spiritus dicat Ecclesiis.
verses.english: 'He who has an ear, let him understand and pay close attention to what the Holy Spirit is saying to all the Churches.'

verses.latin: Post hæc vidi : et ecce ostium apertum in cælo, et vox prima, quam audivi quasi tubæ loquentis mecum, dicens : Ascende huc, et ostendam tibi quæ oportet fieri post hæc.
verses.english: After these events, I looked, and behold, a door stood open in Heaven. Then I heard the first voice I had heard before—a voice like a trumpet speaking to me. It said, "Come up here! And I will show you what must happen after these things."

verses.latin: Et statim fui in spiritu : et ecce sedes posita erat in cælo, et super sedem sedens.
verses.english: Immediately, I was transported in spirit, and behold, there was a throne set in Heaven, and upon the throne, Someone was seated.

verses.latin: Et qui sedebat, similis erat aspectu lapidis jaspidis, et sardinis : et iris erat in circuitu sedis similis visioni smaragdæ.
verses.english: The One seated there looked like jasper and sardine stones. And around the throne, there was a rainbow, looking like an emerald.

verses.latin: Et in circuitu sedis sedilia viginti quatuor : et super thronos viginti quatuor seniores sedentes, circumamicti vestimentis albis, et in capitibus eorum coronæ aureæ.
verses.english: Around that throne were twenty-four smaller thrones, and on these twenty-four thrones sat twenty-four elders. They were clothed in white robes, and on their heads were crowns of gold.

verses.latin: Et de throno procedebant fulgura, et voces, et tonitrua : et septem lampades ardentes ante thronum, qui sunt septem spiritus Dei.
verses.english: From the throne came flashes of lightning, voices, and peals of thunder. And seven burning lamps were before the throne, which represent the seven Spirits of God—the fullness of the Holy Spirit.

verses.latin: Et ante sedem quasi mare vitreum simile crystallo : et in medio sedis, et in circuitu sedis quatuor animalia plena oculis ante et retro.
verses.english: And before the throne was what looked like a sea of glass, clear as crystal. And in the center of the throne, and around the throne, were four living creatures, full of eyes in front and behind.

verses.latin: Et animal primum simile leoni : et secundum animal simile vitulo : et tertium animal habens faciem quasi hominis : et quartum animal simile aquilæ volanti.
verses.english: The first living creature was like a lion. The second living creature was like a young bull. The third living creature had a face like that of a man. And the fourth living creature was like an eagle in flight.

verses.latin: Et quatuor animalia, singula eorum habebant alas senas : et in circuitu, et intus plena sunt oculis : et requiem non habebant die ac nocte, dicentia : Sanctus, Sanctus, Sanctus Dominus Deus omnipotens, qui erat, et qui est, et qui venturus est.
verses.english: Each of the four living creatures had six wings. They were full of eyes all around and within. They never ceased, day or night, saying: "Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord God Almighty, He who was, and who is, and who is to come."

verses.latin: Et cum darent illa animalia gloriam, et honorem, et benedictionem sedenti super thronum, viventi in sæcula sæculorum,
verses.english: And whenever those living creatures gave glory, and honor, and blessing to the One seated on the throne—to Him who lives for all ages, forever and ever—

verses.latin: procident viginti quatuor seniores ante sedentem in throno, et adorabunt viventem in sæcula sæculorum, et mittent coronas suas ante thronum, dicentes :
verses.english: the twenty-four elders would fall down before the One seated on the throne and worship Him who lives for all ages, forever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, declaring:

verses.latin: Dignus es Domine Deus noster accipere gloriam, et honorem, et virtutem : quia tu creasti omnia, et propter voluntatem tuam erant, et creata sunt.
verses.english: "You are worthy, Our Lord and Our God, to receive glory, and honor, and power. Because You created all things, and by Your will, they existed and were created."

verses.latin: Et vidi in dextra sedentis super thronum, librum scriptum intus et foris, signatum sigillis septem.
verses.english: And I saw in the right hand of Him who sat upon the throne a scroll. This scroll was written on both its inner and outer surfaces, and it was sealed with seven seals.

verses.latin: Et vidi angelum fortem, prædicantem voce magna: Quis est dignus aperire librum, et solvere signacula ejus?
verses.english: And I saw a mighty angel. He was proclaiming with a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open this scroll and break its seals?"

verses.latin: Et nemo poterat in cælo, neque in terra, neque subter terram, aperire librum, neque respicere illum.
verses.english: And no one in the universe, nor on the earth, nor in the underworld, was able to open the scroll or even to look at it.

verses.latin: Et ego flebam multum, quoniam nemo dignus inventus est aperire librum, nec videre eum.
verses.english: And I began to weep profusely because no one was found worthy to open the scroll or even to examine it.

verses.latin: Et unus de senioribus dixit mihi: Ne fleveris: ecce vicit leo de tribu Juda, radix David, aperire librum, et solvere septem signacula ejus.
verses.english: And one of the elders said to me, "Do not weep. Behold, the Lion from the tribe of Judah—the promised descendant of David who is the Root and source of David's royal line—He has conquered. He is worthy to open the scroll and to break its seven seals."

verses.latin: Et vidi: et ecce in medio throni et quatuor animalium, et in medio seniorum, Agnum stantem tamquam occisum, habentem cornua septem, et oculos septem: qui sunt septem spiritus Dei, missi in omnem terram.
verses.english: And I looked, and behold, in the center, between the throne and the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb. This Lamb appeared as if it had been slain, bearing the marks of sacrifice. He had seven horns and seven eyes, which represent the seven Spirits of God sent throughout the entire earth.

verses.latin: Et venit, et accepit de dextra sedentis in throno librum.
verses.english: And the Lamb came and took the scroll from the right hand of Him who sat upon the throne.

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset librum, quatuor animalia, et viginti quatuor seniores ceciderunt coram Agno, habentes singuli citharas, et phialas aureas plenas odoramentorum, quæ sunt orationes sanctorum.
verses.english: And when the Lamb was about to open the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before Him. Each of them had a harp and a golden bowl full of incense; these bowls contain the prayers of the saints.

verses.latin: Et cantabant canticum novum, dicentes: Dignus es, Domine, accipere librum, et aperire signacula ejus: quoniam occisus es, et redemisti nos Deo in sanguine tuo ex omni tribu, et lingua, et populo, et natione:
verses.english: And they sang a new song, declaring, "You are worthy, O Lord, to receive the scroll and to open its seals. For you were slain, and by your precious blood, you have ransomed us for God—rescuing people from every tribe, language, nation, and people group."

verses.latin: et fecisti nos Deo nostro regnum, et sacerdotes: et regnabimus super terram.
verses.english: You have made us into a kingdom and priests for our God, and we shall reign over the earth.

verses.latin: Et vidi: et audivi vocem angelorum multorum in circuitu throni, et animalium, et seniorum: et erat numerus eorum millia millium:
verses.english: And I looked, and I heard the voice of many angels encircling the throne, the living creatures, and the elders. Their number was countless—millions upon millions.

verses.latin: dicentium voce magna: Dignus est Agnus, qui occisus est, accipere virtutem, et divinitatem, et sapientiam, et fortitudinem, et honorem, et gloriam, et benedictionem.
verses.english: They were saying with a loud voice, "The Lamb who was slain is worthy to receive all power, and divine authority, and perfect wisdom, and immense strength, and honor, and glory, and blessing!"

verses.latin: Et omnem creaturam, quæ in cælo est super terram, et sub terra, et quæ sunt in mari, et quæ in eo sunt: omnes audivi dicentes: Sedenti in throno, et Agno: benedictio, et honor, et gloria, et potestas in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: And I heard every creature in the entire universe—those in the sky, and on the earth, and under the earth, and in the sea—every single one of them, saying: "To Him who sits upon the throne, and to the Lamb, be blessing, and honor, and glory, and dominion forever and ever!"

verses.latin: Et quatuor animalia dicebant: Amen. Et viginti quatuor seniores ceciderunt in faciem, et adoraverunt viventem in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: And the four living creatures were saying, "Amen!" And the twenty-four elders fell down on their faces and adored Him who lives forever and ever.

verses.latin: Et vidi quando aperuisset Agnus unum de septem sigillis, et audivi unum de quatuor animalibus dicens tamquam vocem tonitrui: Veni, et vide.
verses.english: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures speak with a voice like thunder, saying: “Come, and see.”

verses.latin: Et vidi: et ecce equus albus, et qui sedebat super illum, habebat arcum, et data est ei corona, et exivit vincens ut vinceret.
verses.english: And I looked, and behold, a white horse appeared. He who sat on it had a bow, and a crown was given to him. He went forth conquering, and to conquer all things.

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset sigillum secundum, audivi secundum animal dicens: Veni, et vide.
verses.english: And when He had opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say: “Come, and see.”

verses.latin: Et exivit alius equus rufus, et qui sedebat super illum, datum est ei ut sumeret pacem de terra, et ut invicem se interficiant, et datus est illi gladius magnus.
verses.english: And another horse went out, a red one. It was given to him who sat on it to take peace from the earth, so that people would kill one another. A great sword was also given to him.

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset sigillum tertium, audivi tertium animal dicens: Veni, et vide. Et ecce equus niger: et qui sedebat super illum, habebat stateram in manu sua.
verses.english: And when He had opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say: “Come, and see.” And behold, a black horse appeared, and he who sat on it had a balance in his hand.

verses.latin: Et audivi tamquam vocem in medio quatuor animalium dicentem: Bilibris tritici denario, et tres bilibres hordei denario: et vinum, et oleum ne læseris.
verses.english: And I heard a voice, as it were, from the midst of the four living creatures, saying: “A measure of wheat will cost a denarius, and three measures of barley will cost a denarius, but do not harm the wine and the oil.”

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset sigillum quartum, audivi vocem quarti animalis dicentis: Veni, et vide.
verses.english: And when He had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say: “Come, and see.”

verses.latin: Et ecce equus pallidus, et qui sedebat super illum, nomen illi Mors, et infernus sequebatur eum: et data est illi potestas super quatuor partes terræ, interficere gladio, fame, et morte, et bestiis terræ.
verses.english: And behold, a pale horse appeared, and he who sat upon it was named Death, and the realm of the dead followed closely with him. Power was given to him over a fourth part of the earth, to kill by the sword, and by famine, and by plagues, and by the wild beasts of the earth.

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset sigillum quintum, vidi subtus altare animas interfectorum propter verbum Dei, et propter testimonium quod habebant,
verses.english: And when He had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain because of the word of God and because of the testimony of faith they had always held.

verses.latin: et clamabant voce magna dicentes: Usquequo Domine sanctus et verus non judicas et vindicas sanguinem nostrum de iis qui habitant in terra?
verses.english: And they cried out with a loud voice, saying: “How long, O holy and true Lord, will You not judge and avenge our blood on those who live on the earth?”

verses.latin: Et datæ sunt illis singulæ stolæ albæ: et dictum est illis ut requiescerent adhuc tempus modicum, donec impleatur numerus conservorum et fratrum eorum, qui interficiendi sunt sicut et illi.
verses.english: And white robes were given to each of them, and they were told that they should rest for a little while longer, until the full number of their fellow servants and their brethren are complete—those who are also to be killed, just as they were.

verses.latin: Et vidi cum aperuisset sigillum sextum: et ecce terræmotus magnus factus est, et sol factus est niger tamquam saccus cilicinus: et luna tota facta est sicut sanguis:
verses.english: And I saw when He had opened the sixth seal, and behold, a great earthquake happened, and the sun became black like sackcloth made of hair, and the entire moon became like blood.

verses.latin: et stellæ de cælo ceciderunt super terram, sicut ficus mittit grossos suos cum a vento magno movetur:
verses.english: And the stars from the sky fell upon the earth, just as a fig tree casts its unripe figs when it is shaken by a great wind.

verses.latin: et cælum recessit sicut liber involutus: et omnis mons, et insulæ de locis suis motæ sunt.
verses.english: And the sky receded like a scroll being rolled up, and every mountain and island was moved out of its place.

verses.latin: Et reges terræ, et principes, et tribuni, et divites, et fortes, et omnis servus, et liber absconderunt se in speluncis, et in petris montium:
verses.english: And the kings of the earth, and the princes, and the military commanders, and the rich, and the mighty, and every slave and every free person hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains.

verses.latin: Et dicunt montibus, et petris: Cadite super nos, et abscondite nos a facie sedentis super thronum, et ab ira Agni:
verses.english: And they said to the mountains and to the rocks: “Fall upon us and hide us from the face of Him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb.”

verses.latin: quoniam venit dies iræ magnus, et quis poterit stare?
verses.english: For the great day of their wrath has come, and who will be able to stand against it?”

verses.latin: Post haec vidi quatuor Angelos stantes super quatuor angulos terrae, tenentes quatuor ventos terrae, ne flaret ventus super terram, neque super mare, neque in ullam arborem.
verses.english: After these visions, I saw four Angels standing at the four corners of the earth. They were holding back the four winds of the earth, so that no wind could blow upon the earth, nor upon the sea, nor upon any tree.

verses.latin: Et vidi alterum Angelum ascendentem ab ortu solis, habentem signum Dei vivi: et clamavit voce magna quatuor Angelis, quibus datum est nocere terrae et mari,
verses.english: Then I saw another Angel coming up from the direction of the rising sun. This Angel had the seal of the living God. He cried out with a loud voice to the four Angels who had been given the power to harm the earth and the sea.

verses.latin: dicens: Nolite nocere terrae, et mari, neque arboribus, quoadusque signemus servos Dei nostri in frontibus eorum.
verses.english: He told them: "Do not harm the earth, nor the sea, nor the trees, until we have put a seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God."

verses.latin: Et audivi numerum signatorum, centum quadraginta quatuor millia signatorum ex omni tribu filiorum Israël.
verses.english: And I heard the total number of those who were sealed: 144,000 people were sealed, from every tribe of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Ex tribu Juda duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Ruben duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Gad duodecim millia signati:
verses.english: From the tribe of Judah, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Reuben, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Gad, 12,000 were sealed.

verses.latin: ex tribu Aser duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Nephthali duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Manasse duodecim millia signati:
verses.english: From the tribe of Asher, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Manasseh, 12,000 were sealed.

verses.latin: ex tribu Simeon duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Levi duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Issachar duodecim millia signati:
verses.english: From the tribe of Simeon, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Levi, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Issachar, 12,000 were sealed.

verses.latin: ex tribu Zabulon duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Joseph duodecim millia signati: ex tribu Benjamin duodecim millia signati.
verses.english: From the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Joseph, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Benjamin, 12,000 were sealed.

verses.latin: Post haec vidi turbam magnam, quam dinumerare nemo poterat, ex omnibus gentibus, et tribubus, et populis, et linguis stantes ante thronum, et in conspectu Agni, amicti stolis albis, et palmae in manibus eorum:
verses.english: After these things, I saw a great multitude that no one could count. They came from every nation, and from all tribes, and peoples, and languages. They were standing before the throne of God and in the presence of the Lamb of God, clothed in shining white robes and holding palm branches in their hands.

verses.latin: et clamabant voce magna, dicentes: Salus Deo nostro, qui sedet super thronum, et Agno.
verses.english: And they cried out with a loud voice, saying: "Salvation comes from our God, who sits upon the throne, and from the Lamb!"

verses.latin: Et omnes Angeli stabant in circuitu throni, et Seniorum, et quatuor animalium: et ceciderunt in conspectu throni in facies suas, et adoraverunt Deum,
verses.english: And all the Angels were standing around the throne, and around the Elders, and the four living creatures. They all fell on their faces before the throne and worshipped God.

verses.latin: dicentes: Amen. Benedictio, et claritas, et sapientia, et gratiarum actio, honor, et virtus, et fortitudo Deo nostro in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
verses.english: saying: "Amen! Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, honor, and power, and strength belong to our God for ever and ever. Amen!"

verses.latin: Et respondit unus de Senioribus, dicens mihi: Hi, qui amicti sunt stolis albis, qui sunt? et unde venerunt?
verses.english: Then one of the Elders spoke to me, asking: "Who are these people who are clothed in shining white robes? And where did they come from?"

verses.latin: Et dixi illi: Domine mi, tu scis. Et dixit mihi: Hi sunt, qui venerunt de tribulatione magna, et laverunt stolas suas, et dealbaverunt eas in sanguine Agni.
verses.english: And I said to him: "My Lord, you are the one who knows." And he said to me: "These are the ones who have come out of the great tribulation. They have washed their robes and made them white by the blood of the Lamb."

verses.latin: Ideo sunt ante thronum Dei, et serviunt ei die ac nocte in templo ejus: et qui sedet in throno, habitabit super illos.
verses.english: Therefore, they are before the throne of God and serve Him day and night in His temple. And the One who sits on the throne will spread His tabernacle of protection over them.

verses.latin: Non esurient amplius, neque sitient amplius, neque cadet super illos sol, neque ullus aestus:
verses.english: They will never be hungry again, and they will never be thirsty again. Neither will the sun beat down on them, nor any scorching heat.

verses.latin: quoniam Agnus, qui in medio throni est, reget illos, et deducet eos ad vitae fontes aquarum: et absterget Deus omnem lacrimam ab oculis eorum.
verses.english: For the Lamb, who is at the very center of the throne, will be their Shepherd. He will lead them to the springs of the waters of life, and God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.

verses.latin: Et cum aperuisset sigillum septimum, factum est silentium in caelo quasi media hora.
verses.english: And when the Lamb had opened the seventh seal, there was a solemn silence in the spiritual realm of heaven, lasting for about half an hour.

verses.latin: Et vidi septem angelos stantes in conspectu Dei: et datae sunt illis septem tubae.
verses.english: I then saw seven angels standing before the very presence of God, and seven trumpets were given to them.

verses.latin: Et alius angelus venit, et stetit ante altare habens thuribulum aureum: et data sunt illi incensa multa, ut daret de orationibus sanctorum omnium super altare aureum, quod est ante thronum Dei.
verses.english: Another angel then came and stood before the heavenly altar, holding a golden censer. Much incense was given to him, so that he could offer it along with the prayers of all the holy ones on the golden altar that stands before God’s throne.

verses.latin: Et ascendit fumus incensorum de orationibus sanctorum de manu angeli coram Deo.
verses.english: And the smoke of the incense, carrying the prayers of God's holy people, ascended from the angel's hand into the presence of God.

verses.latin: Et accepit angelus thuribulum, et implevit illud de igne altaris, et misit in terram: et facta sunt tonitrua, et voces, et fulgura, et terraemotus magnus.
verses.english: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw the fire down onto the earth. At once, there were great peals of thunder, roaring voices, flashes of lightning, and a mighty earthquake.

verses.latin: Et septem angeli, qui habebant septem tubas, paraverunt se ut tuba canerent.
verses.english: And the seven angels, who held the seven trumpets, prepared themselves to blow them.

verses.latin: Et primus angelus tuba cecinit, et facta est grando et ignis, mista in sanguine, et missum est in terram, et tertia pars terrae combusta est, et tertia pars arborum concremata est, et omne foenum viride combustum est.
verses.english: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire, mingled with blood, which was then cast down onto the earth. As a result, one-third of the earth was burned up, one-third of the trees were burned, and all the green grass was completely consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Et secundus angelus tuba cecinit: et velut mons magnus igne ardens missus est in mare, et facta est tertia pars maris sanguis.
verses.english: Then the second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a massive mountain, blazing with fire, was hurled into the sea. One-third of the sea then turned into blood.

verses.latin: Et mortua est tertia pars creaturae eorum, quae habent animas in mari, et tertia pars navium interiit.
verses.english: One-third of all the living creatures in the sea died, and one-third of all the ships were destroyed.

verses.latin: Et tertius angelus tuba cecinit: et cecidit de caelo stella magna, ardens sicut facula, et cecidit in tertiam partem fluminum, et in fontes aquarum:
verses.english: The third angel sounded his trumpet, and a great star, burning like a blazing torch, fell from the sky. It landed upon one-third of the rivers and the springs of water.

verses.latin: Et nomen stellae dicitur Absinthium. Et facta est tertia pars aquarum in absinthium: et multi hominum mortui sunt de aquis, quia amarae factae sunt.
verses.english: The name of the star is called "Wormwood," referring to its bitter effect. And one-third of the waters turned bitter like wormwood, and many people died from drinking these waters because they had become so bitter.

verses.latin: Et quartus angelus tuba cecinit: et percussa est tertia pars solis, et tertia pars lunae, et tertia pars stellarum, ita ut obscuraretur tertia pars eorum, et diei non luceret pars tertia, et noctis similiter.
verses.english: The fourth angel sounded his trumpet, and one-third of the sun was struck, one-third of the moon, and one-third of the stars. Consequently, one-third of their light was darkened, so that one-third of the day had no light, and similarly, one-third of the night was also dark.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et audivi vocem unius aquilae volantis per medium caeli, dicentis magna voce: Vae, vae, vae habitantibus in terra, de ceteris vocibus tubae trium angelorum, qui erant tuba canituri.
verses.english: I then looked and heard an eagle flying in the middle of the sky, crying out with a loud voice: "Woe! Woe! Woe to those who live on the earth, because of the remaining trumpet blasts of the three angels who are still about to sound their trumpets!"

verses.latin: Et quintus Angelus tuba cecinit: et vidi stellam de cælo cecidisse in terram, et data est ei clavis putei abyssi.
verses.english: The fifth angel then blew his trumpet. I then saw a star—a heavenly being—fall from the sky and land on the earth. This fallen star was given a key to unlock the bottomless pit of the abyss.

verses.latin: Et aperuit puteum abyssi: et ascendit fumus putei, sicut fumus fornacis magnæ: et obscuratus est sol, et aër de fumo putei.
verses.english: He opened the bottomless pit, and a vast amount of smoke rose from the pit, like the smoke from a massive furnace. The sun and the very air itself were both darkened by this smoke that came from the pit.

verses.latin: Et de fumo exierunt locustæ in terram: et data est illis potestas, sicut habent potestatem scorpiones terræ.
verses.english: Then, from the smoke, swarms of these locust-like creatures emerged and spread across the earth. They were given a destructive power, similar to the power that earthly scorpions have when they sting.

verses.latin: Et præceptum est illis ne læderent fœnum terræ, neque omne viride, neque omnem arborem: nisi tantum homines, qui non habent signum Dei in frontibus suis.
verses.english: They were explicitly commanded not to harm any vegetation—not the grass, nor any green plant, nor any tree. Their only target was to be those people who did not have the mark of God on their foreheads.

verses.latin: Et datum est illis ne occiderent eos: sed ut cruciarent mensibus quinque: et cruciatus eorum sicut cruciatus scorpionis cum percutit hominem.
verses.english: These creatures were not allowed to kill their victims. Instead, they were permitted to inflict torment upon them for a period of five months. The pain they caused was as severe as the excruciating pain a person feels when stung by a scorpion.

verses.latin: Et in diebus illis quærent homines mortem, et non invenient: et desiderabunt mori, et fugiet mors ab eis.
verses.english: During that time of suffering, people will desperately search for death, yet they will not be able to find it. They will long to die, but death itself will evade them and keep them alive to suffer.

verses.latin: Et similitudines locustarum, similes equis paratis in prælium: et super capita earum, quasi coronæ similes auro: et facies earum sicut facies hominum.
verses.english: The appearance of these locust-like creatures was like horses equipped for battle. On their heads, they seemed to wear something like crowns made of gold, and their faces resembled human faces.

verses.latin: Et habebant capillos sicut capillos mulierum: et dentes earum sicut dentium leonum.
verses.english: They had hair that looked like women's hair, and their teeth were as sharp and strong as the teeth of lions.

verses.latin: Et habebant loricas sicut loricas ferreas, et vox alarum earum sicut vox curruum multorum equorum currentium in bellum.
verses.english: They were protected by breastplates that seemed to be made of iron. The sound of their wings was as deafening as the noise of many chariots pulled by numerous horses charging into battle.

verses.latin: Et habebant caudas similes scorpionum, et aculei in caudis earum erant: et potestas illarum nocere hominibus mensibus quinque.
verses.english: These creatures possessed tails similar to those of scorpions, and their tails contained deadly stings. Their power to inflict harm on people was limited to five months.

verses.latin: Et habebant super se regem, Angelum abyssi cui nomen Hebraice Abaddon, Græce autem Apollyon, Latine habens nomen Exterminans.
verses.english: These creatures had a king ruling over them—the angel of the bottomless pit. In Hebrew, his name is Abaddon, which means "destruction." In Greek, his name is Apollyon, also meaning "destroyer," and in Latin, his name is Exterminans, meaning "Exterminator."

verses.latin: Væ unum abiit, et ecce adhuc veniunt duo Væ post hæc.
verses.english: The first "woe"—a period of intense suffering—has now concluded. But observe, two more such periods of woe are still coming after this.

verses.latin: Et sextus Angelus tuba cecinit: et audivi vocem unam ex quatuor cornibus altaris aurei, quod est ante oculos Dei, dicentem sexto Angelo, qui habebat tubam: Solve quatuor Angelos, qui alligati sunt in flumine magno Euphrate.
verses.english: Then the sixth angel blew his trumpet. I heard a single voice speaking from the four horns of the golden altar that stands before the very presence of God. This voice commanded the sixth angel, who held the trumpet, saying, "Release the four angels who are held bound at the great river Euphrates."

verses.latin: Et soluti sunt quatuor Angeli, qui parati erant in horam, et diem, et mensem, et annum, ut occiderent tertiam partem hominum.
verses.english: So the four angels were released. They had been precisely prepared for this specific hour, day, month, and year, to carry out their mission: to kill one-third of all humankind.

verses.latin: Et numerus exercitus equitatus ducenties millies denorum millium. Et audivi numerum eorum.
verses.english: The number of the army of horsemen was an enormous two hundred million. I personally heard their exact number stated.

verses.latin: Et sic vidi equos in visione: et qui sedebant super eos, habebant loricas igneas, et hyacinthinas, et sulphureas, et capita equorum erant quasi capita leonum: et de ore eorum procedebat ignis, et fumus, et sulphur.
verses.english: And this is how I saw the horses in the vision: their riders wore breastplates that were fiery red, dark blue, and sulfur-yellow. The horses' heads resembled the heads of lions, and from their mouths issued fire, smoke, and sulfur.

verses.latin: Et ab his tribus plagis occisa est tertia pars hominum, de igne, et fumo, et sulphure, quod exibat de ore ipsorum.
verses.english: It was by these three plagues—the fire, the smoke, and the sulfur that erupted from the mouths of the horses—that one-third of all humanity was killed.

verses.latin: Nam potestas eorum in ore eorum est, et in caudis eorum: nam caudæ eorum similes serpentibus habentes capita: et in his lædunt.
verses.english: Indeed, their destructive power resides in both their mouths and their tails. Their tails are like venomous serpents, each having its own head, and it is with these that they inflict harm.

verses.latin: Nam caudæ eorum similes serpentibus habentes capita: et in his lædunt.
verses.english: Indeed, their tails are like serpents, each having its own head, and it is with these serpent-like tails that they inflict harm.

verses.latin: Et ceteri homines, qui non sunt occisi in his plagis, neque pœnitentiam egerunt de operibus manuum suarum, ut non adorarent dæmonia, et simulacra aurea, et argentea, et ærea, et lapidea, et lignea, quæ neque videre possunt, neque audire, neque ambulare:
verses.english: Despite these devastating plagues, the rest of humanity who were not killed still did not repent of the evil deeds they had done with their own hands. They continued to worship demons and idols made of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood—lifeless objects that can neither see, hear, nor walk.

verses.latin: Et non egerunt pœnitentiam ab homicidiis suis, neque a veneficiis suis, neque a fornicatione sua, neque a furtis suis.
verses.english: They did not repent of their murders, nor of their sorceries and use of poisons, nor of their sexual immoralities, nor of their thefts.

verses.latin: Et vidi alium angelum fortem ascendentem de caelo, amictum nube, et iris in capite ejus, et facies ejus erat ut sol, et pedes ejus tamquam columna ignis:
verses.english: Then I saw another powerful angel descending from the sky, clothed in a cloud, with a rainbow over his head. His face was like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire.

verses.latin: et habebat in manu sua libellum apertum: et posuit pedem suum dextrum super mare, sinistrum autem super terram.
verses.english: In his hand, he held an open scroll. He placed his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land.

verses.latin: Et clamavit voce magna, sicut cum leo rugit. Et cum clamasset, locuta sunt septem tonitrua voces suas.
verses.english: And he cried out with a loud voice, like a lion roaring. When he had cried out, the seven thunders uttered their voices.

verses.latin: Et cum locuta fuissent septem tonitrua voces suas, eram scripturus: et audivi vocem de caelo dicentem mihi: Signa quae locuta sunt septem tonitrua: et noli ea scribere.
verses.english: And when the seven thunders had spoken their voices, I was about to write them down. But I heard a voice from the sky telling me, "Seal up the things which the seven thunders have spoken; do not write them."

verses.latin: Et angelus, quem vidi stantem super mare et super terram, levavit manum suam ad caelum:
verses.english: Then the angel whom I saw standing over the sea and over the land raised his hand to the sky.

verses.latin: et juravit per viventem in saecula saeculorum, qui creavit caelum, et ea quae in illo sunt, et terram, et ea quae in ea sunt, et mare, et ea quae in eo sunt: Quia tempus non erit amplius:
verses.english: And he swore by the One who lives forever and ever, who created the universe and all the things that are within it, and the land and all the things that are on it, and the sea and all the things that are within it: that there would be no more delay.

verses.latin: sed in diebus vocis septimi angeli, cum coeperit tuba canere, consummabitur mysterium Dei, sicut evangelizavit per servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: But in the days when the seventh angel will sound his trumpet, when he begins to sound his trumpet, then the mystery of God will be completed, just as He announced through His servants, the prophets.

verses.latin: Et vocem de caelo audivi iterum loquentem mecum, et dicentem: Vade, et accipe libellum apertum de manu angeli stantis super mare et super terram.
verses.english: And I heard the voice from the sky speaking with me again, and it said, "Go, take the open scroll from the hand of the angel who is standing over the sea and over the land."

verses.latin: Et abii ad angelum, dicens ei ut daret mihi libellum. Et dixit mihi: Accipe, et devora illum: et faciet in ventre tuo amaritudinem, sed in ore tuo erit dulce tamquam mel.
verses.english: So I went to the angel, asking him to give me the scroll. And he said to me, "Take it, and eat it. It will make your stomach bitter, but in your mouth, it will be as sweet as honey."

verses.latin: Et accepi libellum de manu angeli, et devoravi illum: et erat in ore meo tamquam mel dulce: et cum devorassem illum, amarus factus est venter meus.
verses.english: And I took the scroll from the angel's hand and ate it. And in my mouth, it was as sweet as honey, but when I had eaten it, my stomach became bitter.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Oportet te iterum prophetare populis, et gentibus, et linguis, et regibus multis.
verses.english: And the angel said to me, "You must prophesy again to many peoples, and nations, and languages, and kings."

verses.latin: Et datus est mihi calamus similis virgae, dicens: Surge, et metire templum Dei, et altare, et adorantes in eo.
verses.english: And I was given a measuring rod, much like a staff, with a voice saying: "Rise up, and measure God's true Temple, and the Altar, and those who genuinely worship within it."

verses.latin: Atrium autem quod est foris templi ejice foras, et ne metiaris illud: quoniam datum est Gentibus, et civitatem sanctam calcabunt mensibus quadraginta duobus.
verses.english: But the outer court, the part of the Temple that is outside, do not measure that; instead, leave it out. For it has been given over to the non-believers, who will trample upon the holy city for forty-two months—a specific period of persecution.

verses.latin: Et dabo duobus testibus meis, et prophetabunt diebus mille ducentis sexaginta, amicti saccis.
verses.english: And I will give great power to My two witnesses, and they will prophesy for one thousand two hundred and sixty days—which is the same forty-two months—clothed in sackcloth as a sign of penance and mourning.

verses.latin: Hi sunt duae olivae, et duo candelabra in conspectu Domini terrae stantes.
verses.english: These two witnesses are the two olive trees and the two lampstands, standing in the very presence of the Lord who rules the earth, continuously supplied with divine grace and light.

verses.latin: Et si quis voluerit eis nocere, ignis exiet de ore eorum, et devorabit inimicos eorum: et si quis voluerit eis nocere, sic oportet illum occidi.
verses.english: And if anyone desires to harm them, divine judgment, like fire, will come out of their mouths and consume their enemies. Indeed, if anyone tries to harm them, they must be killed by this means of divine retribution.

verses.latin: Hi habent potestatem claudere caelum, ne pluat diebus prophetiae ipsorum: et habent potestatem super aquas convertere eas in sanguinem, et percutere terram omni plaga quotiescumque voluerint.
verses.english: These witnesses have the divine power to shut up the sky, so that no rain falls during the days of their prophecy. They also have power over the waters to turn them into blood, and to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they desire—just like Moses and Elijah.

verses.latin: Et cum finierint testimonium suum, bestia quae ascendit de abysso, faciet adversum illos bellum, et vincet illos, et occidet illos.
verses.english: And when they have finished their testimony and their prophetic mission, the Beast that ascends from the abyss—a demonic, anti-Christ power—will make war against them, overcome them, and kill them.

verses.latin: Et corpora eorum jacebunt in plateis civitatis magnae, quae vocatur spiritualiter Sodoma et Aegyptus, ubi et Dominus eorum crucifixus est.
verses.english: And their bodies will lie in the public square of the great city, which is symbolically called Sodom for its wickedness and Egypt for its oppression, the very place where their Lord was crucified, representing the world's rejection of God.

verses.latin: Et videbunt de tribubus et populis et linguis et Gentibus corpora eorum per dies tres et dimidium: et corpora eorum non sinunt poni in monumentis.
verses.english: And people from every tribe, nation, language, and Gentile group will gaze upon their unburied bodies for three and a half days, and they will not allow their bodies to be placed in tombs, denying them a dignified burial.

verses.latin: Et gratulabuntur super illos, qui habitant in terra, et epulabuntur: et munera mittent invicem, quoniam hi duo prophetae cruciaverunt eos qui habitabant super terram.
verses.english: And those who inhabit the earth will rejoice over their deaths and celebrate loudly. They will even send gifts to one another, because these two prophets had tormented all those who lived on the earth with their calls to repentance and their divine judgments.

verses.latin: Et post dies tres et dimidium, spiritus vitae a Deo intravit in eos. Et steterunt super pedes suos, et terror magnus cecidit super eos qui viderunt illos.
verses.english: But after the three and a half days, the very breath of life from God entered into them. And they stood upright on their feet, and tremendous fear gripped everyone who saw this miraculous resurrection.

verses.latin: Et audierunt vocem magnam de caelo dicentem eis: Ascendite huc. Et ascenderunt in caelum in nubibus: et viderunt illos inimici eorum.
verses.english: Then they heard a loud voice from the sky telling them, "Come up here!" And they ascended into the sky, carried up in clouds, while their enemies watched them and saw their divine vindication.

verses.latin: Et in illa hora factus est terraemotus magnus, et decima pars civitatis corruit: et occisi sunt in terraemotu nomina hominum septem millia: et reliqui in timorem sunt missi, et dederunt gloriam Deo caeli.
verses.english: At that very moment, a great earthquake struck, causing a tenth of the symbolic city to collapse. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the survivors, overcome by terror, gave glory to the God who rules over the sky.

verses.latin: Secundum vae abiit: et ecce vae tertium veniet cito.
verses.english: The second judgment-woe has passed, and watch closely—the third and final judgment-woe is about to come quickly.

verses.latin: Et septimus Angelus tuba cecinit: et factae sunt voces magnae in caelo, dicentes: Factum est regnum hujus mundi Domini nostri, et Christi ejus, et regnabit in saecula saeculorum.
verses.english: And the seventh Angel blew his trumpet. Then, loud voices rang out through the universe, declaring: "The kingdom of this world has now become the eternal kingdom of Our Lord and His Anointed One, and He shall reign over all of it forever and ever!"

verses.latin: Et viginti quatuor seniores, qui in conspectu Dei sedebant in sedibus suis, ceciderunt in facies suas, et adoraverunt Deum, dicentes:
verses.english: And the twenty-four elders, who were always seated before God on their thrones, fell prostrate on their faces and worshipped God, saying:

verses.latin: Gratias agimus tibi, Domine Deus omnipotens, qui es, et qui eras, et qui venturus es: qui assumpsisti virtutem tuam magnam, et regnasti.
verses.english: "We give You thanks, Lord God Almighty, Who always is, and Who always was, and Who is always to come—because You have now taken up Your tremendous power and have begun Your eternal reign."

verses.latin: Et iratae sunt Gentes, et advenit ira tua, et tempus mortuorum judicari, et reddere mercedem servis tuis prophetis, et sanctis, et timentibus nomen tuum, pusillis et magnis, et disperdere eos qui corruperunt terram.
verses.english: "The nations raged against You, but Your righteous wrath has now come. It is the appointed time for the dead to be judged, and for You to give rewards to Your servants—the prophets and the saints, and to all who revere Your Name, from the least important to the greatest. And it is time for You to utterly destroy those who corrupted the earth."

verses.latin: Et apertum est templum Dei in caelo: et visa est arca testamenti ejus in templo ejus. Et facta sunt fulgura, et voces, et terraemotus, et grando magna.
verses.english: Then the very Temple of God in the universe was opened, and the Ark of His Covenant was plainly seen inside His Temple. This revelation was accompanied by flashes of lightning, loud rumblings, thunderclaps, a great earthquake, and massive hailstones falling, signifying divine presence and judgment.

verses.latin: Et signum magnum apparuit in caelo: mulier amicta sole, et luna sub pedibus ejus, et in capite ejus corona stellarum duodecim:
verses.english: Then a great sign appeared in the sky: A woman was clothed with the sun, with the moon beneath her feet, and on her head was a crown of twelve stars, representing the twelve Apostles and the fullness of the Church.

verses.latin: et in utero habens, clamabat parturiens, et cruciabatur ut pariat.
verses.english: She was pregnant and cried out in the pain of childbirth, referring to the Virgin Mary giving birth to Christ, and the Church laboring to bring Christ to the world.

verses.latin: Et visum est aliud signum in caelo: et ecce draco magnus rufus habens capita septem, et cornua decem: et in capitibus ejus diademata septem:
verses.english: Then another sign was seen in the sky: And behold, a great red dragon appeared. It had seven heads and ten horns, and on its heads were seven royal crowns, signifying the vast power and dominion of Satan, the Adversary.

verses.latin: et cauda ejus trahebat tertiam partem stellarum caeli, et misit eas in terram: et draco stetit ante mulierem, quae erat paritura, ut cum peperisset, filium ejus devoraret.
verses.english: Its tail swept down a third of the stars from the sky and cast them to the earth, representing the fallen angels who rebelled with Satan. The Dragon then stood before the Woman who was about to give birth, so that when she delivered, he might devour her Son, referencing Satan's attempts to destroy Christ.

verses.latin: Et peperit filium masculum, qui recturus erat omnes gentes in virga ferrea: et raptus est filius ejus ad Deum, et ad thronum ejus.
verses.english: And she gave birth to a Son, a male child, who is destined to rule all nations with an iron scepter. Her Son, Jesus Christ, was immediately caught up to God and to His throne, signifying His Ascension and divine rule.

verses.latin: Et mulier fugit in solitudinem ubi habebat locum paratum a Deo, ut ibi pasceretur diebus mille ducentis sexaginta.
verses.english: The Woman then fled into the wilderness, where she had a place prepared by God, that she might be nourished there for one thousand two hundred and sixty days, symbolizing the Church's period of persecution and divine protection.

verses.latin: Et factum est praelium magnum in caelo: Michaël et angeli ejus praeliabantur cum dracone, et draco pugnabat, et angeli ejus:
verses.english: And a great battle took place in the sky: Michael, the Archangel, and his angels fought against the Dragon. And the Dragon and his angels fought back.

verses.latin: et non valuerunt, neque locus inventus est eorum amplius in caelo.
verses.english: But they were not strong enough, and their place was found no more in the heavens, as Satan and his demons were utterly defeated and cast out.

verses.latin: Et projectus est draco ille magnus, serpens antiquus, qui vocatur Diabolus, et Satanas, qui seducit universum orbem: et projectus est in terram, et angeli ejus cum illo projecti sunt.
verses.english: So the great Dragon was cast down, that ancient serpent, who is called the Devil and Satan, he who deceives the whole world. He was cast down to the earth, and his angels were cast down with him.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem magnam in caelo dicentem: Nunc facta est salus, et virtus, et regnum Dei nostri, et potestas Christi ejus: quia projectus est accusator fratrum nostrorum, qui accusabat illos ante conspectum Dei nostri die ac nocte.
verses.english: And I heard a loud voice in the sky saying: 'Now salvation has come, and strength, and the Kingdom of our God, and the power of His Christ! Because the accuser of our brothers, who accused them before the sight of our God day and night, has been cast down!'

verses.latin: Et ipsi vicerunt illum propter sanguinem Agni, et propter verbum testimonii sui, et non dilexerunt animas suas usque ad mortem.
verses.english: And they overcame him because of the Blood of the Lamb, which is Jesus Christ's sacrifice, and because of the word of their testimony to the truth, and they did not love their lives even to the point of death, showing their ultimate fidelity.

verses.latin: Propter hoc laetamini caeli, et qui habitatis in eis. Vae terrae, et mari, quia descendit Diabolus ad vos habens iram magnam, sciens quod modicum tempus habet.
verses.english: Therefore, rejoice, O skies, and you who dwell in them! But woe to the earth and to the sea, for the Devil has come down to you, having great wrath, knowing that he has only a short time left for his evil work!

verses.latin: Et postquam vidit draco, quod projectus esset in terram, persecutus est mulierem, quae peperit masculum.
verses.english: And after the Dragon saw that he had been cast down to the earth, he persecuted the Woman, who had given birth to the male child, redirecting his wrath against the Church.

verses.latin: Et datae sunt mulieri duae alae aquilae magnae ut volaret in desertum in locum suum ubi alitur per tempus, et tempora, et dimidium temporis a facie serpentis.
verses.english: And to the Woman were given two wings of a great eagle, so that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, away from the face of the serpent, signifying God's divine protection of the Church.

verses.latin: Et misit serpens ex ore suo post mulierem, aquam tamquam flumen, ut eam faceret trahi a flumine.
verses.english: And the serpent cast out of his mouth, after the Woman, water like a river, so that he might cause her to be swept away by the current, representing various destructive forces like heresy or persecution aimed at overwhelming the Church.

verses.latin: Et adjuvit terra mulierem, et aperuit terra os suum, et absorbuit flumen, quod misit draco de ore suo.
verses.english: But the earth helped the Woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed up the river that the Dragon had cast out of his mouth, showing how divine providence often uses earthly means to protect the Church.

verses.latin: Et iratus est draco super mulierem: et abiit facere praelium cum reliquis de semine ejus, qui custodiunt mandata Dei, et habent testimonium Jesu Christi.
verses.english: And the Dragon was enraged with the Woman, and he went to wage war with the rest of her offspring, those who keep the commandments of God and hold to the testimony of Jesus Christ, signifying Satan's ongoing war against individual believers and the faithful remnant of the Church.

verses.latin: Et vidi de mari bestiam ascendentem habentem capita septem, et cornua decem, et super cornua ejus diademata decem, et super capita ejus nomina blasphemiae.
verses.english: And I saw a beast rise up from the depths of the sea, and this beast had seven heads and ten horns. On its horns were ten crowns, and on its heads were blasphemous names.

verses.latin: Et bestia, quam vidi, similis erat pardo, et pedes ejus sicut pedes ursi, et os ejus sicut os leonis. Et dedit illi draco virtutem suam, et potestatem magnam.
verses.english: The beast I saw was like a leopard in body, but its feet were like a bear's feet, and its mouth was like a lion's mouth. The Dragon—Satan himself—gave this beast its power, its throne, and its great authority.

verses.latin: Et unum de capitibus ejus quasi occisum in mortem: et plaga mortis ejus curata est. Et admirata est in universam terram bestia.
verses.english: One of its heads appeared to have suffered a mortal wound, as if it had been killed, but its deadly wound was healed. The entire world was astonished by this beast and followed it in wonder.

verses.latin: Et adoraverunt draconem, qui dedit potestatem bestiae: et adoraverunt bestiam, dicentes: Quis similis bestiae? et quis poterit pugnare cum illa?
verses.english: And they worshipped the Dragon, because he had given his authority to the beast. They also worshipped the beast, saying, "Who is like the beast? And who is able to wage war against it?"

verses.latin: Et datum est ei os loquens magna, et blasphemias: et data est illi potestas facere menses quadraginta duos.
verses.english: The beast was given a mouth that spoke arrogant boasts and blasphemies against God. And it was given authority to exercise its power for forty-two months.

verses.latin: Et aperuit os suum in blasphemias ad Deum, blasphemare nomen ejus, et tabernaculum ejus, et eos qui in caelo habitant.
verses.english: It opened its mouth to utter blasphemies against God, to blaspheme His holy name, His sacred dwelling place, and those who dwell in the spiritual realm with Him.

verses.latin: Et datum est illi bellum facere cum sanctis, et vincere eos. Et data est illi potestas in omnem tribum, et populum, et linguam, et nationem.
verses.english: It was also granted to the beast to make war against God's holy people and to conquer them. And it was given authority over every tribe, people, language, and nation on earth.

verses.latin: Et adorabunt eum omnes, qui habitant in terra, quorum non sunt scripta nomina in libro vitae Agni, qui occisus est ab origine mundi.
verses.english: All who live on the earth will worship it—everyone whose name has not been written from the very beginning of the world in the Book of Life of the Lamb, who was slain for the sins of humanity.

verses.latin: Si quis habet aures, audiat.
verses.english: If anyone has ears to hear this truth, let him pay attention.

verses.latin: Qui in captivitatem duxerit, in captivitatem vadet: qui in gladio occiderit, oportet eum gladio occidi. Hic est patientia, et fides sanctorum.
verses.english: Whoever is destined for captivity will go into captivity; and whoever is to be killed by the sword must be killed by the sword. This calls for the perseverance and the steadfast faith of God's holy people.

verses.latin: Et vidi aliam bestiam ascendentem de terra, et habebat cornua duo similia Agni, et loquebatur sicut draco.
verses.english: Then I saw another beast coming up out of the earth. It had two horns like those of a lamb, but it spoke with the voice of the Dragon.

verses.latin: Et potestatem prioris bestiae omnem faciebat in conspectu ejus: et fecit terram, et habitantes in ea, adorare bestiam primam, cujus curata est plaga mortis.
verses.english: This second beast exercised all the authority of the first beast on its behalf, and it forced the earth and all its inhabitants to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound had been healed.

verses.latin: Et fecit signa magna, ut etiam ignem faceret de caelo descendere in terram in conspectu hominum.
verses.english: It performed great and miraculous signs, even causing fire to come down from the sky to the earth in the plain sight of all people.

verses.latin: Et seduxit habitantes in terra propter signa, quae data sunt illi facere coram bestia, dicens habitantibus in terra, ut faciant imaginem bestiae, quae habet plagam gladii, et vixit.
verses.english: It deceived those who dwell on the earth through the signs it was allowed to perform on behalf of the first beast. It ordered the inhabitants of the earth to make an image in honor of the beast that had been wounded by the sword and yet lived.

verses.latin: Et datum est illi, ut daret spiritum imagini bestiae, et ut loqueretur imago bestiae: et faceret ut quicumque non adorassent imaginem bestiae, occiderentur.
verses.english: The second beast was then allowed to give life to the image of the first beast, so that the image could speak and could cause all who refused to worship the image of the beast to be killed.

verses.latin: Et faciet omnes, pusillos et magnos, et divites et pauperes, et liberos et servos habere characterem in dextera manu sua, aut in frontibus suis:
verses.english: It also forced all people, both small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a distinguishing mark on their right hands or on their foreheads.

verses.latin: Et ne quis possit emere aut vendere, nisi qui habet characterem, aut nomen bestiae, aut numerum nominis ejus.
