verses.english: No one was allowed to buy or sell anything unless they had this mark, which was either the name of the beast or the number representing its name.

verses.latin: Hic sapientia est. Qui habet intellectum, computet numerum bestiae. Numerus enim hominis est: et numerus ejus DCXLVI.
verses.english: Here is wisdom. Let anyone with true understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is a human number. That number is six hundred sixty-six.

verses.latin: Et vidi: et ecce Agnus stabat super montem Sion, et cum eo centum quadraginta quatuor millia habentes nomen ejus, et nomen Patris ejus scriptum in frontibus suis.
verses.english: And I saw: and behold, the Lamb was standing on Mount Zion. With Him were one hundred and forty-four thousand people who had His name and the name of His Father written on their foreheads.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem de cælo, tamquam vocem aquarum multarum, et tamquam vocem tonitrui magni: et vocem quam audivi, sicut citharœdorum citharizantium in citharis suis.
verses.english: And I heard a voice from the sky, like the sound of many waters, and like the sound of a great thunder. The voice I heard was also like harpers playing on their harps.

verses.latin: Et cantabant quasi canticum novum ante sedem, et ante quatuor animalia, et seniores: et nemo poterat dicere canticum, nisi illa centum quadraginta quatuor millia, qui empti sunt de terra.
verses.english: And they were singing what seemed to be a new song before the throne, and before the four living creatures, and the elders. No one could learn that song except those one hundred and forty-four thousand who had been redeemed and purchased from the earth.

verses.latin: Hi sunt qui cum mulieribus non sunt coinquinati: virgines enim sunt. Hi sequuntur Agnum quocumque ierit. Hi empti sunt ex hominibus primitiæ Deo, et Agno:
verses.english: These are those who have not defiled themselves with women; for they are virgins. These follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were purchased from among humanity as the firstfruits for God and for the Lamb.

verses.latin: et in ore eorum non est inventum mendacium: sine macula enim sunt ante thronum Dei.
verses.english: And in their mouth no lie was found. For they are without blemish, standing before the throne of God.

verses.latin: Et vidi alterum Angelum volantem per medium cæli, habentem Evangelium æternum, ut evangelizaret sedentibus super terram, et super omnem gentem, et tribum, et linguam, et populum:
verses.english: And I saw another Angel flying through the middle of the sky, having an eternal Gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and tribe, and tongue, and people.

verses.latin: dicens magna voce: Timete Dominum, et date illi honorem, quia venit hora judicii ejus: et adorate eum, qui fecit cælum et terram, mare et fontes aquarum.
verses.english: Saying with a loud voice: 'Fear the Lord and give Him glory, because the hour of His judgment has come. And worship Him who made the sky and the earth, the sea and the springs of water.'

verses.latin: Et alius Angelus secutus est dicens: Cecidit, cecidit Babylon illa magna: quæ a vino iræ fornicationis suæ potavit omnes gentes.
verses.english: And another Angel followed, saying: 'Fallen, fallen is that great Babylon! She who made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.'

verses.latin: Et tertius Angelus secutus est illos, dicens voce magna: Si quis adoraverit Bestiam, et imaginem ejus, et acceperit characterem in fronte sua, aut in manu sua,
verses.english: And a third Angel followed them, saying with a loud voice: 'If anyone worships the Beast and its image, and receives its mark on his forehead or on his hand,'

verses.latin: hic et ipse bibet de vino iræ Dei, quod mixtum est mero in calice iræ ejus, et cruciabitur igne, et sulphure in conspectu sanctorum Angelorum, et ante conspectum Agni.
verses.english: that person will also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out undiluted into the cup of His wrath. And he will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy Angels and in the presence of the Lamb.

verses.latin: Et fumus tormentorum eorum ascendet in sæcula sæculorum: nec habent requiem die ac nocte, qui adoraverunt Bestiam, et imaginem ejus, et si quis acceperit characterem nominis ejus.
verses.english: And the smoke of their torments will ascend forever and ever. They have no rest day or night, those who worshipped the Beast and its image, and whoever receives the mark of its name.

verses.latin: Hic patientia sanctorum est, qui custodiunt mandata Dei, et fidem Jesu.
verses.english: Here is the perseverance of the saints, those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem de cælo dicentem mihi: Scribe: Beati mortui, qui in Domino moriuntur amodo. Spiritus dicit: ut requiescant a laboribus suis: opera enim illorum sequuntur illos.
verses.english: And I heard a voice from the sky saying to me: 'Write: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from this time forward.' The Spirit says that they will rest from their labors, for their deeds follow them.

verses.latin: Et vidi: et ecce nubem candidam, et super nubem sedentem similem Filio hominis, habentem in capite suo coronam auream, et in manu sua falcem acutam.
verses.english: And I saw: and behold, a white cloud, and seated on the cloud was one like the Son of Man, having on His head a golden crown, and in His hand a sharp sickle.

verses.latin: Et alter Angelus exivit de templo, clamans voce magna ad sedentem super nubem: Mitte falcem tuam, et mete, quoniam venit hora ut metatur, quoniam aruit messis terræ.
verses.english: And another Angel came out of the Temple, crying with a loud voice to the One seated on the cloud: 'Send Your sickle and reap, for the hour to reap has come, because the harvest of the earth is ripe and withered.'

verses.latin: Et misit qui sedebat super nubem falcem suam in terram, et demessa est terra.
verses.english: And the One who was seated on the cloud sent His sickle onto the earth, and the earth was reaped.

verses.latin: Et alter Angelus exivit de templo, quod est in cælo, habens et ipse falcem acutam.
verses.english: And another Angel came out of the Temple that is in the spiritual realm, also having a sharp sickle.

verses.latin: Et alius Angelus exivit de altari, habens potestatem supra ignem: et clamavit voce magna ad eum qui habebat falcem acutam, dicens: Mitte falcem tuam acutam, et vindemia botros vineæ terræ: quoniam maturæ sunt uvæ ejus.
verses.english: And another Angel came out from the altar, having authority over fire. And he cried with a loud voice to the one who had the sharp sickle, saying: 'Send your sharp sickle and gather the clusters of the earth's vine, for its grapes are fully ripe.'

verses.latin: Et misit Angelus falcem suam in terram, et vindemiavit vineam terræ, et misit in lacum iræ Dei magnum.
verses.english: And the Angel sent his sickle onto the earth, and harvested the vine of the earth, and threw the grapes into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

verses.latin: Et calcatus est lacus extra civitatem, et exivit sanguis de lacu usque ad frenos equorum per stadia mille sexcenta.
verses.english: And the winepress was trampled outside the city, and blood flowed from the winepress up to the horses' bridles for a distance of one thousand six hundred stadia.

verses.latin: Et vidi aliud signum in caelo magnum et mirabile: angelos septem, habentes plagas septem novissimas: quoniam in illis consummata est ira Dei.
verses.english: Then I saw another great and amazing sign in the heavenly realm: it was seven angels holding the seven final plagues, because in these plagues, the wrath of God is brought to its ultimate completion.

verses.latin: Et vidi quasi mare vitreum mistum igne, et eos qui vicerunt bestiam, et imaginem ejus, et numerum nominis ejus, stantes super mare vitreum, habentes citharas Dei:
verses.english: And I saw something that looked like a sea of glass, mixed with fire. Standing upon this fiery glass sea were those who had triumphed over the beast, and its image, and the number of its name. They were holding harps, given by God.

verses.latin: Et cantant canticum Moysi servi Dei, et canticum Agni, dicentes: Magna et mirabilia opera tua, Domine Deus omnipotens: justæ et veræ viæ tuæ, Rex sæculorum.
verses.english: And they sing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb. They declared: "Great and wonderful are Your works, O Lord God Almighty. Your ways are just and true, O King of the ages, the Lord who reigns through all time."

verses.latin: Quis non timebit te, Domine, et magnificabit nomen tuum? quia solus pius es: quoniam omnes gentes venient, et adorabunt in conspectu tuo, quoniam manifestatæ sunt judicia tua.
verses.english: "Who will not fear You, O Lord, and glorify Your name? For You alone are holy and righteous. Indeed, all the nations will come and worship before Your presence, because Your righteous judgments have been made known to all."

verses.latin: Et post hæc vidi: et ecce apertum est templum tabernaculi testimonii in cælo:
verses.english: And after these things, I looked again, and behold, the temple of the tabernacle of testimony in the heavenly realm was opened.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt septem angeli de templo, habentes septem plagas, vestiti lapide mundo et candido, et præcincti circa pectora zonis aureis.
verses.english: And the seven angels came out from the temple, holding the seven plagues. They were clothed with pure and bright stone, shimmering with divine radiance, and girded around their chests with golden sashes.

verses.latin: Et unum ex quatuor animalibus dedit septem angelis phialas aureas plenas ira Dei viventis in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels golden bowls, filled to the brim with the wrath of God, the God who lives forever and ever, throughout all ages.

verses.latin: Et impletum est templum fumo de majestate Dei, et de virtute ejus: et nemo poterat introire in templum, donec consummarentur septem plagæ septem angelorum.
verses.english: And the temple was filled with smoke, emanating from the majesty of God and from His immense power. And no one was able to enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were fully completed.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem magnam de templo, dicentem septem angelis: Ite, et effundite septem phialas irae Dei in terram.
verses.english: And I heard a loud voice coming from the Temple. It said to the seven angels: 'Go now, and pour out the seven bowls of God's righteous wrath upon the earth.'

verses.latin: Et abiit primus, et effudit phialam suam in terram, et factum est vulnus saevum et pessimum in homines, qui habebant characterem bestiae, et qui adorabant imaginem ejus.
verses.english: So the first angel went and poured out his bowl upon the land. Then a painful and malignant ulcer—a festering sore—appeared on those people who had the mark of the Beast and who worshiped its image.

verses.latin: Et secundus angelus effudit phialam suam in mare: et factus est sanguis tamquam mortui: et omnis anima vivens mortua est in mari.
verses.english: Then the second angel poured out his bowl upon the sea. And the sea became like the blood of a dead person—thick and congealed. Every living creature in the sea died because of this.

verses.latin: Et tertius effudit phialam suam super flumina, et super fontes aquarum: et factus est sanguis.
verses.english: Next, the third angel poured out his bowl upon the rivers and the springs of water. And they also turned into blood.

verses.latin: Et audivi angelum aquarum dicentem: Justus es Domine, qui es, et qui eras sanctus, qui haec judicasti:
verses.english: Then I heard the angel who was responsible for the waters say: 'You are just, O Lord, who exist always, and who always were holy, because You have issued these judgments.'

verses.latin: quia sanguinem sanctorum et prophetarum effuderunt, et sanguinem eis dedisti bibere: digni sunt enim.
verses.english: 'Because they poured out the blood of Your holy ones and Your prophets, You have given them blood to drink in return. For they deserve this punishment.'

verses.latin: Et audivi alterum ab altari dicentem: Etiam Domine Deus omnipotens, vera et justa judicia tua.
verses.english: And I heard another voice coming from the altar, saying: 'Yes, Lord God Almighty! Your judgments are truthful and righteous!'

verses.latin: Et quartus angelus effudit phialam suam in solem: et datum est illi aestus affligere homines, et igne.
verses.english: Then the fourth angel poured out his bowl upon the sun. And power was given to the sun to scorch people with its intense heat and fire.

verses.latin: Et aestuaverunt homines aestu magno: et blasphemaverunt nomen Dei scientes haec plagarum, et poenitentiam non egerunt ut darent illi gloriam.
verses.english: People were scorched by this extreme heat. Yet they cursed the Name of God—who has authority over these plagues—and they refused to repent and give Him glory.

verses.latin: Et quintus angelus effudit phialam suam super sedem bestiae: et factum est regnum ejus tenebrosum, et commanducaverunt linguas suas prae dolore:
verses.english: And the fifth angel poured out his bowl upon the throne of the Beast. Immediately, its kingdom became consumed by darkness, and people bit their tongues in agonizing pain.

verses.latin: et blasphemaverunt Deum caeli prae doloribus, et vulneribus suis: et non egerunt poenitentiam ex operibus suis.
verses.english: They cursed the God of the heavens because of their pains and their sores. Yet they did not repent of their wicked deeds.

verses.latin: Et sextus angelus effudit phialam suam in flumen illud magnum Euphraten: et siccavit aquam ejus, ut praepararetur via regibus ab ortu solis.
verses.english: Then the sixth angel poured out his bowl upon the great Euphrates River. And its water dried up, so that a way might be prepared for the kings who come from the rising of the sun—from the East.

verses.latin: Et vidi de ore draconis, et de ore bestiae, et de ore pseudoprophetae, spiritus tres immundos similies ranis.
verses.english: And I saw three unclean spirits that looked like frogs coming out of the mouth of the Dragon, and out of the mouth of the Beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

verses.latin: Sunt enim spiritus daemoniorum facientes signa: et procedunt ad reges totius terrae, et universi orbis, congregare illos in praelium magni diei Domini omnipotentis.
verses.english: For these are spirits of demons, performing miraculous signs. They go out to the kings of the whole earth and the entire world, to gather them for the battle on the great Day of God Almighty.

verses.latin: Ecce venio sicut fur: Beatus qui vigilat, et custodit vestimenta sua, ne nudus ambulet, et videant turpitudinem ejus.
verses.english: Behold, I am coming unexpectedly, like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays alert and guards his spiritual garments, so that he may not walk around spiritually naked and his shame be seen by all.

verses.latin: Et congregabit illos in locum qui vocatur Hebraice Armagedon.
verses.english: And the demonic spirits gathered them together to the place which is called, in Hebrew, Armageddon.

verses.latin: Et septimus angelus effudit phialam suam in aerem, et exivit vox magna de templo a throno, dicens: Factum est.
verses.english: Then the seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air. And a loud voice came out of the Temple, from the throne of God, saying: 'It is finished! It has happened!'

verses.latin: Et facta sunt fulgura, et voces, et tonitrua, et terraemotus magnus, qualis nunquam fuit ex quo homines fuerunt super terram, tantus terraemotus, et sic magnus.
verses.english: And there were lightning flashes, and rumblings, and thunder, and a great earthquake—such an earthquake as has never occurred since humanity has existed on the earth, so tremendous and so great.

verses.latin: Et facta est civitas magna in tres partes: et civitates gentium ceciderunt. Et Babylon magna venit in memoriam ante Deum, dare ei calicem vini irae indignationis ejus.
verses.english: And the great city split into three parts. The cities of the nations fell into ruin. And great Babylon was remembered before God, so that He might give her the cup of the wine of His fierce, righteous wrath.

verses.latin: Et omnis insula fugit, et montes non sunt inventi.
verses.english: Every island vanished, and the mountains were no longer found.

verses.latin: Et grando magna sicut talentum descendit de caelo in homines: et blasphemaverunt Deum propter plagam grandinis: quoniam magna est facta vehementer.
verses.english: And a tremendous hailstorm—with hailstones weighing as much as a talent, about one hundred pounds each—fell from the sky upon the people. Yet they cursed God because of the plague of the hail, for the plague was exceedingly great.

verses.latin: Et venit unus de septem angelis, qui habebant septem phialas, et locutus est mecum, dicens: Veni, ostendam tibi damnationem meretricis magnae, quae sedet super aquas multas,
verses.english: One of the seven angels who held the seven bowls came and spoke with me, saying: "Come, I will show you the judgment of the great harlot, who sits enthroned over many nations and peoples."

verses.latin: cum qua fornicati sunt reges terrae, et inebriati sunt qui inhabitant terram de vino prostitutionis ejus.
verses.english: The kings of the earth have committed spiritual adultery with her, and those who live on the earth have become drunk and misled by the wine of her spiritual corruption.

verses.latin: Et abstulit me in spiritu in desertum. Et vidi mulierem sedentem super bestiam scarlatam, plenam nominibus blasphemiae, habentem capita septem, et cornua decem.
verses.english: The angel carried me away in spirit into a desolate place. There I saw a woman sitting upon a scarlet beast, which was full of blasphemous names and had seven heads and ten horns.

verses.latin: Et mulier erat circumdata purpura, et coccino, et inaurata auro, et lapide pretioso, et margaritis, habens poculum aureum in manu sua, plenum abominatione, et immunditia fornicationis ejus.
verses.english: The woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold, precious stones, and pearls. She held a golden cup in her hand, full of abominations and the impurities of her spiritual adultery.

verses.latin: Et in fronte ejus nomen scriptum: Mysterium: Babylon magna, mater fornicationum, et abominationum terrae.
verses.english: And upon her forehead was a name written: "A Mystery: Babylon the Great, the mother of spiritual adulteries and abominations of the earth."

verses.latin: Et vidi mulierem ebriam de sanguine sanctorum, et de sanguine martyrum Jesu. Et miratus sum cum vidissem illam admiratione magna.
verses.english: And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the holy ones and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus. When I saw her, I was greatly astonished and filled with wonder.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi angelus: Quare miraris? Ego dicam tibi sacramentum mulieris, et bestiae quae portat eam, quae habet capita septem, et cornua decem.
verses.english: And the angel said to me: "Why are you astonished? I will tell you the hidden truth about the woman and concerning the beast that carries her, which has seven heads and ten horns."

verses.latin: Bestia quam vidisti, fuit, et non est, et ascensura est de abysso, et in interitum ibit: et mirabuntur inhabitantes terram, quorum non sunt scripta nomina in libro vitae a constitutione mundi, videntes bestiam, quia fuit, et non est.
verses.english: The beast which you saw was, and is not, and will ascend from the abyss, and then go into destruction. And those who live on the earth, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will be astonished when they see the beast, because it was, and is not, yet is about to be present again.

verses.latin: Et hic est sensus qui habet sapientiam: Septem capita, septem montes sunt, super quos mulier sedet, et reges septem sunt.
verses.english: Here is a profound understanding for one who possesses wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains, upon which the woman is seated, and these also represent seven kings.

verses.latin: Quinque ceciderunt, unus est, et alter nondum venit: et cum venerit, breve tempus eum oportet manere.
verses.english: Five of these kings have fallen, one is currently reigning, and another has not yet come. And when he comes, he must remain for a short time.

verses.latin: Et bestia quae erat, et non est: et ipsa octava est, et de septem est, et in interitum vadit.
verses.english: And the beast that was, and is not, this very beast is also the eighth king, yet it is one of the seven, and it goes into destruction.

verses.latin: Et decem cornua, quae vidisti, decem reges sunt: qui regnum nondum acceperunt, sed potestatem tamquam reges una hora accipient post bestiam.
verses.english: And the ten horns which you saw are ten kings, who have not yet received royal power, but they will receive authority as kings for one hour with the beast.

verses.latin: Hi unum consilium habent, et virtutem, et potestatem suam bestiae tradent.
verses.english: These kings share one common purpose, and they will hand over their strength and authority to the beast.

verses.latin: Hi pugnabunt cum Agno, et Agnus vincet eos: quoniam Dominus dominorum est, et Rex regum, et qui cum illo sunt, vocati, et electi, et fideles.
verses.english: These will fight with the Lamb, but the Lamb will conquer them, because He is the Lord of lords and King of kings. And those who are with Him are the called, the chosen, and the faithful.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Aquae quas vidisti, ubi meretrix sedet, populi sunt, et turbae, et gentes, et linguae.
verses.english: And he said to me: "The waters which you saw, where the harlot sits, they are peoples, and multitudes, and nations, and languages."

verses.latin: Et decem cornua quae vidisti in bestia, hi odio habebunt meretricem, et desolatam facient illam, et nudam, et carnes ejus manducabunt, et igni eam comburent.
verses.english: And the ten horns which you saw, belonging to the beast, these kings will hate the harlot. They will make her desolate and stripped bare, they will devour her flesh, and burn her with fire.

verses.latin: Deus enim dedit in corda eorum ut faciant quod placitum est illi, et ut dent regnum suum bestiae donec impleantur verba Dei.
verses.english: For God has put it into their hearts to carry out His will, and to give their royal power to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.

verses.latin: Et mulier, quam vidisti, est civitas magna, quae habet regnum super reges terrae.
verses.english: And the woman whom you saw is the great city, which holds dominion over the kings of the earth.

verses.latin: Et post haec vidi alium Angelum descendentem de caelo, habentem potestatem magnam: et terra illuminata est a gloria ejus.
verses.english:
And after these things, I saw another Angel descending from the sky,
who had great power.
And the entire earth was illuminated by his glorious presence.

verses.latin: Et exclamavit in forti voce, dicens: Cecidit, cecidit Babylon magna: et facta est habitatio dæmoniorum, et custodia omnis spiritus immundi, et custodia omnis volucris immundæ, et odibilis:
verses.english:
And the Angel cried out with a strong voice, saying: “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the Great!
She has become a dwelling place for demons,
a prison for every unclean spirit,
and a prison for every unclean and hateful bird.

verses.latin: quia de ira fornicationis ejus biberunt omnes gentes: et reges terræ cum illa fornicati sunt: et mercatores terræ de virtute deliciarum ejus divites facti sunt.
verses.english:
This has happened because all nations have drunk of the wine of her passionate fornication.
The kings of the earth have committed fornication with her,
and the merchants of the earth have grown rich from the power of her luxurious living.”

verses.latin: Et audivi aliam vocem de caelo dicentem: Exite de illa populus meus: ut ne participes sitis delictorum ejus, et de plagis ejus non accipiatis.
verses.english:
And I heard another voice from the sky saying:
“Come out from her, My people, all you faithful ones!
Do this so that you may not be sharers in her sins,
and so that you may not receive any of her plagues.

verses.latin: Quoniam pervenerunt peccata ejus usque ad caelum, et recordatus est Dominus iniquitatum ejus.
verses.english:
For her sins have reached all the way up to the sky, to the throne of God’s judgment,
and the Lord has remembered her iniquities and will act upon them.

verses.latin: Reddite illi sicut et ipsa reddidit vobis: et duplate duplicia secundum opera ejus: in poculo quo miscuit, miscete illi dupliciter.
verses.english:
Pay her back just as she herself has paid you, for her evil deeds.
Double her double according to her works.
In the cup which she has mixed for others, mix for her double the amount.

verses.latin: Quantum glorificavit se, et in deliciis fuit, tantum date illi tormentum et luctum: quia in corde suo dicit: Sedeo regina, et vidua non sum, et luctum non videbo.
verses.english:
As much as she glorified herself and lived luxuriously and in pleasure,
so much give her torment and sorrow.
For in her heart she says with pride: ‘I sit as a queen, and I am not a widow, and I shall see no sorrow or suffering.’

verses.latin: Ideo in una die venient plagæ ejus, mors, et luctus, et fames, et igni comburetur: quia fortis est Deus qui judicat illam.
verses.english:
Therefore, in one single day her plagues will come upon her: death, and sorrow, and famine.
And she will be burned with fire.
This will happen because strong is the Lord God, the Almighty, who judges her.

verses.latin: Et flebunt, et plangent se super illam reges terræ, qui cum illa fornicati sunt, et in deliciis vixerunt, cum viderint fumum incendii ejus:
verses.english:
And the kings of the earth who committed fornication with her and lived luxuriously will weep and mourn over her,
when they see the smoke of her burning destruction.

verses.latin: longe stantes propter timorem tormentorum ejus, dicentes: Væ, væ civitas illa magna, Babylon illa fortis civitas: quoniam una hora venit judicium tuum.
verses.english:
They will stand far off because of the fear of her torment,
saying: “Woe, woe, that great city, Babylon, that strong city!
For in one hour your judgment has come!”

verses.latin: Et negotiatores terræ flebunt, et lugebunt super illam: quoniam nemo emet mercem eorum amplius.
verses.english:
And the merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her,
because no one will buy their merchandise any longer.

verses.latin: mercem auri, et argenti, et lapidis pretiosi, et margaritæ, et byssi, et purpuræ, et serici, et cocci, et omne lignum thyinum, et omnia vasa eboris, et omnia vasa de lapide pretioso, et de ære, et de ferro, et de marmore,
verses.english:
Their merchandise included gold, and silver, and precious stones, and pearls,
and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet,
and all fragrant thyme wood,
and all vessels made of ivory,
and all vessels made of precious stone, and of bronze, and of iron, and of marble.

verses.latin: et cinnamomum, et amomum, et odoramenta, et unguentum, et thus, et vinum, et oleum, et similam, et triticum, et jumenta, et oves, et equos, et rhedas, et mancipia, et animas hominum.
verses.english:
Also cinnamon, and amomum (a fragrant spice), and perfumes, and ointment, and frankincense,
and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat,
and cattle, and sheep, and horses, and carriages or chariots,
and slaves, and the very souls of men.

verses.latin: Et poma desiderii animæ tuæ discesserunt a te, et omnia pinguia et præclara perierunt a te, et amplius illa jam non invenient.
verses.english:
And the fruits your soul passionately desired have departed from you.
And all your rich and splendid things have perished from you,
and they will never, ever be found again.

verses.latin: Mercatores horum, qui divites facti sunt ab ea, longe stabunt propter timorem tormentorum ejus, flentes et lugentes,
verses.english:
The merchants of these things, who grew rich from their dealings with her,
will stand far off because of the fear of her torment,
weeping and mourning.

verses.latin: et dicentes: Væ, væ civitas illa magna, quæ erat amicta byssino, et purpura, et cocco, et inaurata auro, et lapide pretioso, et margaritis:
verses.english:
And they will be saying: “Woe, woe, that great city,
which was clothed in fine linen, and purple, and scarlet,
and adorned with gold, and precious stone, and pearls!

verses.latin: quoniam una hora destitutæ sunt tantæ divitiæ: et omnis gubernator, et omnis qui in navibus locum tenet, et nautæ, et quotquot mari navigant, longe steterunt,
verses.english:
For in one hour such great riches have been laid waste and brought to nothing!”
And every captain, and every passenger on ships, and sailors, and all who sail the sea,
stood far off.

verses.latin: et clamaverunt videntes locum incendii ejus, dicentes: Quæ similis huic civitati magnæ?
verses.english:
And they cried out, seeing the place of her burning,
saying: “What city was ever like this great city?!”

verses.latin: Et miserunt pulverem super capita sua, et clamaverunt flentes et lugentes, dicentes: Væ, væ civitas illa magna, in qua divites facti sunt omnes qui habebant naves in mari de pretiis ejus: quoniam una hora desolata est.
verses.english:
And they threw dust upon their heads as a sign of deep mourning,
and they cried out, weeping and mourning, saying: “Woe, woe, that great city!
In her, all who had ships at sea grew rich from her wealth and her costly prices.
For in one single hour she has been utterly desolated!”

verses.latin: Exsulta super eam cælum, et sancti Apostoli, et Prophetæ: quoniam judicavit Deus judicium vestrum de illa.
verses.english:
Rejoice over her, you inhabitants of the celestial realms, meaning angels and saints,
and you holy Apostles and Prophets!
This is because God has judged your cause against her and brought justice upon her.

verses.latin: Et sustulit unus Angelus fortis lapidem quasi molarem magnum, et misit in mare, dicens: Hoc impetu mittetur Babylon magna illa civitas, et ultra jam non invenietur.
verses.english:
And one mighty Angel lifted up a stone like a great millstone, an enormous grinding stone,
and threw it into the sea, saying: “With such violence and force shall Babylon, that great city, be thrown down into oblivion,
and she shall never, ever be found again.”

verses.latin: Et vox citharœdorum, et musicorum, et tibia canentium, et tubæ non audietur in te amplius: et omnis artifex omnis artis non invenietur in te amplius: et vox molæ non audietur in te amplius:
verses.english:
And the sound of harpists, and musicians, and flute players, and trumpets will no longer be heard in you.
And no craftsman of any craft or skill will be found in you any longer.
And the sound of the millstone, for daily bread, will not be heard in you any longer.

verses.latin: et lux lucernæ non lucebit tibi amplius: et vox sponsi, et sponsæ non audietur in te amplius: quia mercatores tui erant principes terræ, quia in maleficiis tuis errant omnes gentes.
verses.english:
And the light of a lamp will shine no longer in you, ending all activity.
And the voice of the bridegroom and the bride, signifying joy and new life, will not be heard in you any longer.
This judgment comes because your merchants were the great ones and rulers of the earth,
and because by your sorceries, deceptions, and spiritual manipulations, all nations were led astray into sin.

verses.latin: Et in sanguine Prophetarum, et Sanctorum omnium, qui occisi sunt in terra, inventus est.
verses.english:
And in her was found the blood of Prophets and of all Saints,
of all who were unjustly slain on the earth through the ages.

verses.latin: Post hæc audivi quasi vocem magnam turbarum multarum in cælo, dicentium: Alleluja: salus, et gloria, et virtus est Deo nostro:
verses.english: After these events, I heard what sounded like a massive voice from countless crowds in the spiritual realm, saying: “Praise God! All salvation, all glory, and all power belong to our God.”

verses.latin: quia vera et justa sunt judicia ejus, qui judicavit de meretrice magna, quæ corrupit terram in prostitutione sua, et vindicavit sanguinem servorum suorum de manibus ejus.
verses.english: “Because His judgments are true and just. He has judged the great harlot who corrupted the earth with her immorality, and He has avenged the blood of His servants from her hands.”

verses.latin: Et iterum dixerunt: Alleluja. Et fumus illius ascendit in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: And again they said: “Praise God!” And the smoke of her burning ascended forever and ever.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt viginti quatuor seniores, et quatuor animalia: et adoraverunt Deum sedentem super thronum, dicentes: Amen: Alleluja.
verses.english: And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshipped God, who was seated upon His throne, saying: “So be it! Praise God!”

verses.latin: Et vox de throno exivit dicens: Laudate Deum nostrum omnes servi ejus: et qui timetis eum pusilli et magni.
verses.english: And a voice came forth from the throne, saying: “Praise our God, all you His servants, and you who fear Him, both small and great.”

verses.latin: Et audivi quasi vocem turbæ magnæ, et sicut vocem aquarum multarum, et sicut vocem tonitruorum magnorum, dicentium: Alleluja: quoniam regnavit Dominus Deus noster omnipotens.
verses.english: And I heard what sounded like the voice of a great crowd, and like the sound of many rushing waters, and like the sound of mighty thunderclaps, saying: “Praise God! Because the Lord our Almighty God has begun His reign.”

verses.latin: Gaudeamus, et exsultemus, et demus gloriam ei: quia venerunt nuptiæ Agni, et uxor ejus præparavit se.
verses.english: “Let us rejoice and exult, and let us give glory to Him. Because the Wedding Feast of the Lamb has come, and His Bride has prepared herself for it.”

verses.latin: Et datum est illi ut cooperiretur byssino splendenti et candido. Byssinum enim justificationes sunt sanctorum.
verses.english: And it was granted to her that she should be clothed in fine linen, bright and pure. For the fine linen represents the righteous acts of the saints.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Scribe: Beati qui ad cœnam nuptiarum Agni vocati sunt. Et dixit mihi: Hæc verba Dei vera sunt.
verses.english: And He said to me: “Write this down: Blessed are those who are called to the Wedding Supper of the Lamb.” And He said to me: “These words are the true words of God.”

verses.latin: Et cecidi ante pedes ejus ut adorarem eum. Et dixit mihi: Vide ne feceris: conservus tuus sum, et fratrum tuorum habentium testimonium Jesu. Deum adora. Testimonium enim Jesu est spiritus prophetiæ.
verses.english: And I fell before his feet to worship him. And he said to me: “Do not do that! I am a fellow servant with you and with your brothers who hold to the testimony of Jesus. Worship God alone. For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy itself.”

verses.latin: Et vidi cælum apertum, et ecce equus albus, et qui sedebat super illum, vocabatur Fidelis, et Verax, et cum justitia judicat et pugnat.
verses.english: And then I saw the spiritual realm opened, and behold, a white horse. And the One who sat upon it was called “Faithful” and “True,” and with justice He judges and makes war.

verses.latin: Oculi autem ejus sicut flamma ignis, et in capite ejus diademata multa, et habens nomen scriptum, quod nemo novit nisi ipse.
verses.english: And His eyes were like a flame of fire, and upon His head were many diadems, and He had a name written on Him which no one knows but Himself.

verses.latin: Et vestitus erat veste aspersa sanguine: et vocatur nomen ejus: Verbum Dei.
verses.english: And He was clothed in a vestment dipped in blood, and His name is called: “The Son of God” (The Word of God).

verses.latin: Et exercitus cælorum sequebantur eum in equis albis, vestiti byssino albo et mundo.
verses.english: And the armies of the spiritual realms followed Him on white horses, clothed in fine linen, white and clean.

verses.latin: Et de ore ejus procedit gladius ex utraque parte acutus, ut in ipso percutiat gentes. Et ipse reget eas virga ferrea: et ipse calcat torcular vini furoris iræ Dei omnipotentis.
verses.english: And from His mouth proceeds a sharp, two-edged sword, that with it He may strike down the nations. And He Himself will rule them with a rod of iron. And He Himself treads the winepress of the furious wrath of Almighty God.

verses.latin: Et habet in vestimento, et in femore suo scriptum: Rex regum et Dominus dominantium.
verses.english: And He has written on His vestment and on His thigh: “KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.”

verses.latin: Et vidi unum Angelum stantem in sole, et clamavit voce magna, dicens omnibus avibus, quæ volabant per medium cæli: Venite, et congregamini ad cœnam magnam Dei:
verses.english: And I saw a single Angel standing in the sun, and he cried out with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that flew through the midst of the sky: “Come, gather yourselves together for the great Supper of God.”

verses.latin: ut manducetis carnes regum, et carnes tribunorum, et carnes fortium, et carnes equorum, et sedentium in ipsis, et carnes omnium liberorum, et servorum, et pusillorum, et magnorum.
verses.english: “So that you may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of tribunes, and the flesh of strong men, and the flesh of horses and of those who sat upon them, and the flesh of all free men and of servants, and of both small and great.”

verses.latin: Et vidi bestiam, et reges terræ, et exercitus eorum congregatos facere prælium cum illo, qui sedebat in equo, et cum exercitu ejus.
verses.english: And I saw the Beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies gathered together to make war against the One who sat upon the horse, and against His army.

verses.latin: Et apprehensa est bestia, et cum ea pseudopropheta, qui fecit signa coram ipsa, quibus seduxit eos, qui acceperunt caracterem bestiæ, et qui adoraverunt imaginem ejus. Vivi duo missi sunt in stagnum ignis ardentis sulphure.
verses.english: And the Beast was captured, and with it the false prophet, who had performed signs in its presence, with which he deceived those who had received the mark of the Beast and who had worshipped its image. These two, while still alive, were cast into the lake of fire burning with sulfur.

verses.latin: Et ceteri occisi sunt in gladio sedentis super equum, qui procedit de ore ipsius: et omnes aves saturatæ sunt carnibus eorum.
verses.english: And the rest were slain with the sword of the One who sat upon the horse, which proceeds from His mouth. And all the birds were filled with their flesh.

verses.latin: Et vidi angelum descendentem de cælo, habentem clavem abyssi, et catenam magnam in manu sua.
verses.english: Then I saw an angel coming down from the sky. He was holding the key to the bottomless pit, the Abyss, and a great chain in his hand.

verses.latin: Et apprehendit draconem, serpentem antiquum, qui est diabolus, et Satanas, et ligavit eum per mille annos.
verses.english: He seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is also called the Devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years, a symbolic period of spiritual confinement.

verses.latin: Et misit eum in abyssum, et clausit, et signavit super illum, ne seducat amplius gentes, donec consummentur mille anni: et post hæc oportet illum solvi modico tempore.
verses.english: The angel then threw him into the Abyss, shutting it and sealing it over him. This was so the Devil could not deceive the nations and turn them away from God until the thousand years of spiritual confinement were completed. After that, he must be released for a short time.

verses.latin: Et vidi sedes, et sederunt super eas, et judicium datum est illis: et animas decollatorum propter testimonium Jesu, et propter verbum Dei, et qui non adoraverunt bestiam, neque imaginem ejus, nec acceperunt caracterem ejus in frontibus aut in manibus suis, et sederunt cum Christo mille annis.
verses.english: Then I saw thrones, and those who sat on them were given the authority to judge. I also saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for proclaiming Jesus and God's word, and those who had not worshipped the Beast or its image, nor received its mark on their foreheads or hands. These souls came to life and reigned with Christ for this spiritual period of a thousand years.

verses.latin: Ceteri mortuorum non vixerunt, donec consummentur mille anni. Hæc est resurrectio prima.
verses.english: The rest of the spiritually dead did not come to life in this way until the thousand years were finished. This is what is meant by the first resurrection: a spiritual reawakening and reign with Christ.

verses.latin: Beatus et sanctus qui habet partem in resurrectione prima: in his secunda mors non habet potestatem: sed erunt sacerdotes Dei et Christi: et regnabunt cum illo mille annis.
verses.english: Blessed and holy is anyone who has a part in this first resurrection, meaning a spiritual reign with Christ. Over these, the second death—eternal damnation in hell—has no power. Instead, they will be priests of God and of Christ, and they will reign with Him for this spiritual period of a thousand years.

verses.latin: Et cum consummati fuerint mille anni, solvetur Satanas de carcere suo, et exibit, et seducet gentes, quæ sunt super quatuor angulos terræ, Gog, et Magog, et congregabit eos in prælium, quorum numerus est sicut arena maris.
verses.english: When the thousand years are completed, Satan will be released from his spiritual prison. He will then go out to deceive the nations throughout the whole earth—Gog and Magog, representing all who oppose God—and gather them for a final spiritual battle. Their numbers will be as countless as the sand of the sea.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt super latitudinem terræ, et circumierunt castra sanctorum, et dilectam civitatem.
verses.english: They marched across the broad expanse of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city, which is the Church.

verses.latin: Et descendit ignis a Deo de cælo, et devoravit eos: et diabolus, qui seduxerat eos, missus est in stagnum ignis et sulphuris, ubi et bestia et pseudopropheta cruciabuntur die ac nocte in sæcula sæculorum.
verses.english: Then fire came down from God out of the sky and consumed them all. And the Devil, who had deceived them, was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the Beast and the False Prophet had already been cast. There they will be tormented day and night for all eternity.

verses.latin: Et vidi solium magnum candidum, et sedentem super illud, a cujus conspectu terra et cælum effugerunt, et locus non est inventus eis.
verses.english: Then I saw a great white throne, and One sitting on it. Before His presence, the earth and the sky fled away, and no place was found for them.

verses.latin: Et vidi mortuos, magnos et pusillos, stantes in conspectu throni, et libri aperti sunt: et alius liber apertus est, qui est vitæ: et judicati sunt mortui ex his quæ scripta erant in libris, secundum opera ipsorum.
verses.english: I saw all the dead, both great and small, standing before the throne. Books were opened, which contained records of their lives. And another book was opened, which is the Book of Life. The dead were judged according to their deeds, which were written in those books.

verses.latin: Et dedit mare mortuos, qui in eo erant: et mors et infernus dederunt mortuos suos, qui in ipsis erant: et judicatum est de singulis secundum opera ipsorum.
verses.english: The sea gave up the dead that were in it. And Death and Hades (the realm of the dead) gave up their dead that were in them. Every single person was judged according to what they had done in their lives.

verses.latin: Et mors et infernus missi sunt in stagnum ignis. Hæc est mors secunda.
verses.english: And Death itself and Hades (the realm of the dead) were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death, which is eternal damnation.

verses.latin: Et si quis non est inventus in libro vitæ scriptus, missus est in stagnum ignis.
verses.english: If anyone's name was not found written in the Book of Life, that person was cast into the lake of fire, suffering eternal damnation.

verses.latin: Et vidi caelum novum et terram novam. Primum enim caelum et prima terra abiit, et mare jam non est.
verses.english: I then saw a new universe and a new earth. The old universe and the old earth had passed away, and the sea no longer existed.

verses.latin: Et ego Joannes vidi sanctam civitatem Jerusalem novam, descendentem de caelo a Deo paratam, sicut sponsam ornatam viro suo.
verses.english: And I, John, saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of the sky from God. It was prepared like a bride beautifully adorned for her husband.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem magnam de throno dicentem: Ecce tabernaculum Dei cum hominibus, et habitabit cum eis. Et ipsi populus ejus erunt, et ipse Deus cum eis erit eorum Deus.
verses.english: And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying: 'Behold, the dwelling place of God is with humanity, and He will live with them. They will be His people, and God Himself will be with them as their God.'

verses.latin: Et absterget Deus omnem lacrymam ab oculis eorum: et mors ultra non erit, neque luctus, neque clamor, neque dolor erit ultra, quia prima abierunt.
verses.english: And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying, nor pain anymore, because the former things have passed away.

verses.latin: Et dixit qui sedebat in throno: Ecce nova facio omnia. Et dixit mihi: Scribe, quia haec verba fidelissima sunt, et vera.
verses.english: And He who sat on the throne said: 'Behold, I am making all things new.' He also said to me, 'Write, for these words are utterly trustworthy and true.'

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Factum est. Ego sum Alpha et Omega, principium et finis. Ego sitienti dabo de fonte aquae vitae gratis.
verses.english: And He said to me: 'It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end of all things. To the one who thirsts, I will give water from the fountain of life as a free gift.'

verses.latin: Qui vicerit, possidebit haec: et ero illi Deus, et ille erit mihi filius.
verses.english: The one who overcomes will inherit these things. And I will be his God, and he will be My son.

verses.latin: Timidis autem, et incredulis, et execratis, et homicidis, et fornicatoribus, et veneficis, et idololatris, et omnibus mendacibus, pars illorum erit in stagno ardenti igne et sulphure: quod est mors secunda.
verses.english: But for the cowardly, the unbelieving, the detestable, the murderers, the sexually immoral, the sorcerers, the idolaters, and all liars—their destiny will be in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.

verses.latin: Et venit unus de septem angelis habentibus phialas plenas septem plagis novissimis, et locutus est mecum, dicens: Veni, et ostendam tibi sponsam, uxorem Agni.
verses.english: Then one of the seven angels who held the seven bowls full of the last seven plagues came and spoke with me, saying: 'Come, and I will show you the Bride, the wife of the Lamb.'

verses.latin: Et sustulit me in spiritu in montem magnum et altum: et ostendit mihi civitatem sanctam Jerusalem, descendentem de caelo a Deo,
verses.english: And he carried me away in the Spirit to a great and high mountain, and he showed me the Holy City, Jerusalem, descending out of the sky from God.

verses.latin: habentem claritatem Dei: et lumen ejus simile lapidi pretioso tamquam lapidi jaspidis, sicut crystallum.
verses.english: It had the glory of God. Its radiance was like that of a very precious jewel, like a jasper stone, as clear as crystal.

verses.latin: Et habebat murum magnum et altum habentem portas duodecim: et in portis angelos duodecim, et nomina inscripta, quae sunt nomina duodecim tribuum filiorum Israël.
verses.english: It had a great, high wall with twelve gates. At the gates were twelve angels, and names were inscribed on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Ab oriente portae tres, et ab aquilone portae tres, et ab austro portae tres, et ab occasu portae tres.
verses.english: There were three gates on the east, three on the north, three on the south, and three on the west.

verses.latin: Et murus civitatis habebat fundamenta duodecim, et in ipsis nomina duodecim Apostolorum Agni.
verses.english: The wall of the City also had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve Apostles of the Lamb.

verses.latin: Et qui loquebatur mecum, habebat mensuram arundineam auream, ut metiretur civitatem, et portas ejus, et murum.
verses.english: The angel who spoke with me had a golden measuring rod to measure the City, its gates, and its wall.

verses.latin: Et civitas in quadro posita est, et longitudo ejus tanta est quanta et latitudo: et mensus est civitatem arundine aurea per stadia duodecim millia. Et longitudo, et altitudo, et latitudo ejus aequalia sunt.
verses.english: The City was laid out as a square, and its length was as great as its width. He measured the City with the golden rod, and it was twelve thousand stadia long. Its length, height, and width were all equal.

verses.latin: Et mensus est murum ejus centum quadraginta quatuor cubitorum mensura hominis, quae est angeli.
verses.english: He also measured its wall, which was one hundred and forty-four cubits by human measure—this refers to the unit of measurement that angels use, not their physical size.

verses.latin: Et erat structura muri ejus de lapide jaspide: ipsa vero civitas aurum mundum simile vitro mundo.
verses.english: The wall was built of jasper, and the City itself was pure gold, clear as pure glass.

verses.latin: Et fundamenta muri civitatis omni lapide pretioso ornata erant. Fundamentum primum, jaspis: secundum, sapphirus: tertium, chalcedonius: quartum, smaragdus:
verses.english: The foundations of the City wall were adorned with every kind of precious stone. The first foundation was jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, chalcedony; the fourth, emerald;

verses.latin: quintum, sardonyx: sextum, sardius: septimum, chrysolithus: octavum, beryllus: nonum, topazius: decimum, chrysoprasus: undecimum, hyacinthus: duodecimum, amethystus.
verses.english: the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, chrysolite; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, topaz; the tenth, chrysoprase; the eleventh, hyacinth; the twelfth, amethyst.

verses.latin: Et duodecim portae duodecim margaritae sunt: singulae per singulas erant ex singulis margaritis: et platea civitatis aurum mundum tanquam vitrum perlucidum.
verses.english: The twelve gates were twelve pearls, each gate made from a single pearl. And the main street of the City was pure gold, as transparent as glass.

verses.latin: Et templum non vidi in ea. Dominus enim Deus omnipotens templum illius est, et Agnus.
verses.english: I saw no temple within it, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.

verses.latin: Et civitas non eget sole, neque luna, ut luceant in ea. Claritas enim Dei illuminavit eam, et lucerna ejus est Agnus.
verses.english: The City has no need of the sun or the moon to shine in it, for the glory of God illuminates it, and the Lamb is its lamp.

verses.latin: Et ambulabunt gentes in lumine ejus: et reges terrae afferent gloriam et honorem suum in illam.
verses.english: The nations will walk by its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their glory and honor into it.

verses.latin: Et portae ejus non claudentur per diem: nox enim non erit illic.
verses.english: Its gates will never be shut by day, because there will be no night there.

verses.latin: Et afferent gloriam et honorem gentium in illam.
verses.english: And they will bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.

verses.latin: Non intrabit in eam aliquod coinquinatum, aut faciens abominationem, et mendacium, nisi qui scripti sunt in libro vitae Agni.
verses.english: Nothing unclean will ever enter it, nor will anyone who does what is detestable or practices falsehood. Only those whose names are written in the Lamb's Book of Life will enter.

verses.latin: In medio plateae ejus, et ex utraque parte fluminis, lignum vitae, afferens fructus duodecim per menses singulos, reddens fructum suum, et folia ligni ad sanitatem gentium.
verses.english: In the middle of the city's main street, and on both sides of the river, stood the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruit, yielding its fruit each month, and the leaves of the tree are for the healing of the nations.

verses.latin: Et omne maledictum non erit amplius: sed sedes Dei et Agni in illa erunt, et servi ejus servient illi.
verses.english: And there will be no more curse or damnation. Instead, the throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and His servants will serve Him directly.

verses.latin: Et videbunt faciem ejus: et nomen ejus in frontibus eorum.
verses.english: They will see His face directly, and His name will be visibly marked on their foreheads, showing their complete belonging to Him.

verses.latin: Et nox ultra non erit: et non egebunt lumine lucernae, et lumine solis, quoniam Dominus Deus illuminabit illos, et regnabunt in saecula saeculorum.
verses.english: And there will be no more night. They will not need the light of a lamp or the light of the sun, because the Lord God Himself will enlighten them, and they will reign with Him forever and ever.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Haec verba fidelissima sunt, et vera. Et Dominus Deus spirituum prophetarum, misit Angelum suum ostendere servis suis quae oportet fieri cito.
verses.english: And the angel said to me: "These words are most trustworthy and true. For the Lord God, who inspires the spirits of the prophets, has sent His Angel to show His servants what must soon take place."

verses.latin: Et ecce venio velociter. Beatus qui custodit verba prophetiae libri hujus.
verses.english: "And behold, I am coming quickly. Blessed is the one who truly keeps the words of the prophecy contained in this book."

verses.latin: Et ego Joannes, qui audivi, et vidi haec. Et postquam audissem, et vidissem, cecidi ut adorarem ante pedes Angeli, qui mihi haec ostendebat.
verses.english: And I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. After I had heard and seen them, I fell down to worship before the feet of the Angel who had shown me these things.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Vide ne feceris: conservus enim tuus sum, et fratrum tuorum prophetarum, et eorum qui servant verba libri hujus: Deum adora.
verses.english: And he said to me: "Do not do that! For I am a fellow servant with you, and with your brethren the prophets, and with all those who keep the words of this book. Worship God alone, for He is the only one worthy."

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Ne signaveris verba prophetiae libri hujus: tempus enim prope est.
verses.english: And he said to me: "Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time for these events is near."

verses.latin: Qui nocet, noceat adhuc: et qui in sordibus est, sordescat adhuc: et qui justus est, justificetur adhuc: et sanctus, sanctificetur adhuc.
verses.english: "Let him who does wrong continue to do wrong still, and let him who is filthy remain filthy still. But let him who is just continue to be justified still, and let him who is holy continue to be sanctified still." This means that soon, each person's spiritual state will be fixed.

verses.latin: Ecce venio cito, et merces mea mecum est, reddere unicuique secundum opera sua.
verses.english: "Behold, I am coming quickly, and My reward is with Me, so that I may render to each person according to their works."

verses.latin: Ego sum Alpha et Omega, primus et novissimus, principium et finis.
verses.english: "I am the Alpha and the Omega, which means I am the First and the Last, the very Beginning and the End of all things."

verses.latin: Beati qui lavant stolas suas in sanguine Agni: ut sit potestas eorum in ligno vitae, et per portas intrent in civitatem.
verses.english: Blessed are those who wash their robes in the Blood of the Lamb, so that they may have the right to eat from the tree of life and may enter into the Holy City through its gates.

verses.latin: Foris canes, et venefici, et impudici, et homicidae, et idololatriae, et omnis qui amat et facit mendacium.
verses.english: Outside the Holy City are the dogs—meaning the impure and those who oppose God—along with sorcerers, the sexually immoral, murderers, idolaters, and everyone who loves and practices falsehood.

verses.latin: Ego Jesus misi Angelum meum testificari vobis haec per Ecclesias. Ego sum radix et genus David, stella splendida et matutina.
verses.english: "I, Jesus, have sent My Angel to give you this testimony for all the Churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, the bright, splendid Morning Star."

verses.latin: Et Spiritus et sponsa dicunt: Veni. Et qui audit dicat: Veni. Et qui sitit, veniat: et qui vult, accipiat aquam vitae gratis.
verses.english: And the Holy Spirit and the Church, His Bride, say: "Come, Lord Jesus!" And let everyone who hears this also say: "Come!" Let anyone who is spiritually thirsty come, and let anyone who wills, take the water of life freely, as a gift.

verses.latin: Contesto enim omni audienti verba prophetiae libri hujus: Si quis apposuerit ad haec, apponet Deus super illum plagas scriptas in libro isto.
verses.english: For I solemnly testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If anyone presumes to add to these revealed truths, God will add to him the plagues that are written in this book.

verses.latin: Et si quis diminuerit de verbis libri prophetiae hujus, auferet Deus partem ejus de ligno vitae, et de civitate sancta, et de his quae scripta sunt in libro isto.
verses.english: And if anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his portion from the tree of life and from the Holy City, and from the blessings that are written in this book.

verses.latin: Dicit qui testimonium perhibet istorum: Etiam, venio cito: Amen. Veni, Domine Jesu.
verses.english: He who gives testimony to these things, which is Jesus Himself, says: "Yes, I am coming quickly." Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!

verses.latin: Gratia Domini nostri Jesu Christi cum omnibus vobis. Amen.
verses.english: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.
